In addition, he will create one additional job for one of the people from his community.  Augustin will start also saving for the future in order to create some other sources of income apart from driving.

loans.use: The purchase of one additional motorcycle

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is married and has three children, all of whom attend school. Her spouse makes a living as a driver, and works hard to be sure his family's needs -- particularly for food and schooling -- are met. Anna helps pay the bills as well, by running a bar where most of her customers are men. She supplements the income she earns there by selling second-hand clothes. 

Anna has applied for a loan for Kshs 20,000 loan to buy five crates of beer to sell in her shop. In the future, she hopes to become a wholesaler, and joined Yehu to get the loans and training she needs to meet this goal.

loans.use: to buy five crates of beer to sell to her customers

loans.name: Ramatu

texts.en:
Ramatu M. prepares 'banku' (a dish prepared of maize dough) with different varieties of soups (such as okra, palm nut and groundnut soup) at Abura. Ramatu has received senoir high education.  She is married to a mason. 

Ramatu has been selling 'banku' for some time now. She helps her husband with the general welfare of the home. Her loan will be used to buy more maize to prepare 'banku' and to sell to those who want to buy the raw maize. She hopes to use the new earnings she will be getting as a result of the loan to complete a kitchen she has started renovating.

loans.use: to buy more maize to prepare 'banku' and to sell to those who want to buy raw maize

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Alfredo B. lives in the town of Guinsiliban in Camiguin Province. He is 45 years old, married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, he provides transportation services to local community members. He has been in this business for more than three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from his work.

In 2009, Alfredo joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his life and ability to engage in business. Alfredo has successfully repaid two previous loans from HSPFI, and is applying for a new one, for 9,000 PHP, to buy materials and tools he needs for his business. He plans to use the additional revenue made possible by this loan to educate his children. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy materials and tools for a transportation business

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
Bernadette is 48 years old.  Bernadette is commonly known in the business of selling clothes for women and she has been in this business for about 15 years.  Bernadette's business hours are from 8 am to 5 pm every day.

Bernadette is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company and this loan will allow to expand her business through starting the sale of additional clothes for men and children.  With these additional clothes for sale, Bernadette hopes that she will earn more profit than previously which in turn will allow her to keep reinvesting for better financial stability and a secure future.

loans.use: Different styles of men's and children's clothes

loans.name: Couronne De Vie Plus Group

texts.en:
Aimée K. is 49 years old and leads a loan group called “Couronne Plus” which consists of 27 microentrepreneurs who are committed to develop their businesses by applying for and receiving microloans from Kiva through the MFI HOPE DRC. 

Aimée makes a living running a cellphone booth, and supplements the income she earns there by selling manioc, corn flour and other items. Both lines of work are profitable but the demand for calling services is especially high, and she has decided to take advantage of that demand by opening a telephone booth and selling phone accessories. She works hard and has a long-term goal of opening a small general store. To help reach this goal, she decided to join one of Hope’s groups in June 2009. She makes a profit of about $20 per day, is married and has three children who range in age from 8 to 33.

loans.use: to provide more telephone calling services to her customers

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is 24 years old and makes a living in two ways: by running a beauty salon and selling second-hand clothing and shoes.  Her hair salon is in a busy shopping center that serves many local customers. She has been in this line of work for four years and now has three employees. The many challenges she faces are competition from other salons and the high cost of electricity. 

Pauline plans to use this loan, for 20,000 Kenyan shillings, to buy hair additions/extensions (for “waves” and “wings”) and additional clothing and shoes to sell to her customers.

In the future, Pauline hopes to expand her businesses by buying a car to transport products from one marketplace to another.  In five years, she dreams of being the leading salon-service and clothing provider in her area, for both men and women.

loans.use: To buy products for a beauty salon and a clothing business

loans.name: Gloriose

texts.en:
Gloriose was born in 1981 and is married with one child who is 3 years old. Gloriose's husband helps her in her business so that they earn a lot of money. Gloriose takes care of one dependent; she has 4 years of experience in business of selling green bananas. This business is profitable and that's the reason why it was chosen by her. She employs one person from her community. The hours of her business are from 6 in the morning to 6 in the evening every day except on Sunday.

Gloriose is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of growing her business which will be an advantage for her customers as well as herself because the customers will be satisfied and Gloriose will earn more profit.

loans.use: Expanding her business

loans.name: Charlean

texts.en:
Charlean C. lives in the town of Mahinog in Camiguin Province. She is 25 years old, single and makes a living by running a sari-sari (or variety) retail shop where she sells food and other items used daily by people in her area. She has been in this line of work for more than two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

Earlier this year, Charlean joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She is requesting a  loan of 4,000 PHP, her first, to buy new items to sell to her customers. She plans to use the additional revenue made possible by this loan to continue expanding her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy new items to sell to her customers

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul, 31, is married and has one daughter who is 7 years old. He is the owner of a general store where he sells sugar, cooking oil, flour, bar soap, body oil, toiletries and other general merchandise to local customers. His shop is located in a busy shopping center. He has been in this business for 11 years and his primary challenge is competition from other local shop owners. In addition to his shop, Paul also grows and sells sugar cane to generate additional income. He plans to use the 20,000 KES loan to purchase additional inventory for his general store: sugar, salt, soap, cooking oil, flour, etc.

In the future, Paul hopes to expand his business to a bigger shop so that he can better serve his customers' needs. In 5 years, he dreams of expanding and having other shops in the areas around Kisumu.

loans.use: To purchase items for his store: sugar, salt, soap, cooking oil, flour, etc.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
El Sr. Francisco es casado con la Sra. Teresa tiene 2 hijos menores que aun están en la escuela.
El tiene una despensa bien surtida en donde trabaja con su Sra. Esposa, quien la ayuda con la atención del negocio.
Se iniciaron en la actividad con un dinero que recibió el Sr., como parte de una indemnización que había recibido.
 El señor Francisco también se dedica a otras actividades ocasionales como ser venta ambulante.
Los hijos también   les ayudan  en sus horas libres con atención de la despensa.
Son personas muy trabajadoras, y solicitan el crédito para la compra de aceite, arroz, fideos, productos de limpieza y otros productos de primera necesidad.
texts.en:
Francisco is married to Teresa and has 2 young children who are still in school. He has a well-stocked store where he works with his wife, who helps him attend to the business. They started this activity with money that he received as part of compensation that he had received. Francisco also does other occasional activities such as street vending. Their children also help them with the store in their free time. They are very hard-working people, and are requesting this loan for the purchase of oil, rice, pasta, cleaning products and other staples.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of oil, sugar, pasta, rice, cleaning products, pastries and candies

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a single mother with three children, two attending school, and one who is too young for school. She has been selling secondhand clothes door-to-door for four years.

With this loan, she wants to buy a bundle of secondhand clothes and shoes to sell in the neighboring community. In this business, Susan faces the challenges associated with seasonality. In the future, she would like to have her own shop and supply more to the market.

Susan currently lives in a rental house with electricity and piped water. She pointed out that food is her greatest monthly expense. She decided to join Yehu in order to get a loan and improve her living standards.

loans.use: To buy a bundle of secondhand clothes and shoes

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 33 year-old man who supplies water to local residents, hotels, restaurants and other food kiosks.  He has been in this business for 10 years and has 3 employees. He only has one source of water, and that limitation sometimes causes delays.  In addition to supplying water, Joseph also sells kerosene and paraffin. 

Joseph plans to use this loan to purchase an additional handcart and to buy additional stock of kerosene for resale.

In the future, Joseph hopes to secure a brighter future for his family through entrepreneurship.  In 5 years, his ambition is to purchase an automated pump machine for the sale of paraffin.

Joseph describes himself as hardworking, social, and honest.

loans.use: To purchase an additional hand cart and to buy kerosene for resale

loans.name: Olga

texts.es: Olga tiene 39 años de edad, comparte la vida con su esposo y sus dos hijos en su casa propia. El trabajo que se dedica desde hace 7 años, es la venta de pollo, en un mercado de lo más concurrido de su zona llamado “28 de Noviembre”. Es así que todas las mañanas sale muy temprano para llevar sus productos perecibles a su puesto logrando venderlo hasta las 3pm de la tarde, pues gracias a los años que tiene trabajando en este rubro, ha hecho que sea estable su negocio y gane la preferencia de sus clientes. En un futuro espera poder seguir mejorando su negocio comprando una congeladora para así poder adquirir más mercadería y mantenerla fresca para su venta. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP y siempre se caracterizó por ser muy responsable con sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará mayor cantidad de mercadería y así aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Olga is 39 years old. She shares her life with her husband and two children in a house that they own. For the past 7 years she has been selling chicken in a busy market in her area called "28 de Noviembre" (November 28th). Every morning she leaves very early to take her perishable products to the market and she sells until 3 pm. Thanks to the many years that she has worked in this trade, she has a stable business and her customers prefer her over the competition. In the future she hopes to improve her business by buying a freezer so that she can stock more merchandise and keep it fresh. This is her sixth loan with MFP and she has always been very responsible with her payments. With the loan that she is requesting, she will buy more merchandise so that she can increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more perishable products to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Erika Vanessa

texts.es: La señora Erika tiene 26 años de edad y viene trabajando 1 año con Edaprospo, tiene una tienda dentro de un mercado en la zona “p” de Huaycán, ella vende ropa, zapatos, zapatillas, y otros accesorios que además lo trae a pedidos. Empezó con el negocio vendiendo en un mercado en forma ambulante, Luego su mamá pudo conseguirle ese puesto donde ella vende ahora. Las ganancias le han permitido construir su casa y amoblarla para el bienestar de sus hijos, a Erika le gustaría comprar otro puesto para poder aportar más para su familia. El crédito lo invirtió en la compra de prendas de vestir y algunos accesorios que le habían solicitado.
texts.en:
Erika is 26 years old and has been working with EDAPROSPO for one year. She has a shop in the Huaycán “P” zone market; she sells clothing, shoes, sneakers, and other accessories and she also takes orders. She began her business selling from a traveling cart in a market, and later her mother was able to get this shop space for her, where she now sells her wares. The earnings have allowed her to build and furnish her home for the wellbeing of her children, and Erika would like to buy another spot in the market to be able to better support her family. She will invest this loan in the purchase of clothing and some accessories which have been requested by customers.

Translated from Spanish by Mairead Harris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothing for retail sale

loans.name: Marichi

texts.en:
Marichi M. is from the village of Looc, Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 33 years old. Marichi is married and has 5 children. To make a living, Marichi owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Marichi has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marichi joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marichi has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Marichi is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Marichi from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Ndere Women's Group, Mubende

texts.en:
Operating a produce business has really improved his living conditions, having gotten himself involved in the farming business previously. K. Medad changed his business from a phone-charging business into a farming and produce-selling enterprise and has been doing this business for the last ten years in Mirembe, Mubende.

Medad is able to earn 400,000 Ugandan shillings on a monthly basis. Being a married father of two children, he has been able to cater for his family requirements including meeting the school fees of his children and other necessities.

Medad’s drawback is having a small amount of stock in his business. This loan will enable him to expand his business through buying more stock, thus increasing his supplying capacity to his customers who provide a ready market. This will enable him to earn more revenue and live a more sustaining life as he looks at business expansion.

loans.use: To purchase more produce to sell like maize, coffee and beans

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence has been operating her business of selling secondhand clothes door to door for the last two years. She is happily married with one child who attends school. Her spouse is a taxi driver and helps support his family financially. With this loan of Kshs 20,000 she wants to buy secondhand clothes for adults and children to sell to potential customers in the neighboring community.

She faces the challenge of seasonality, as she has low sales during rainy seasons when she is unable to sell door to door. Florence hopes that one day she will expand her business and open a shop in future. She decided to join Yehu in order to get financial assistance to boost her business. She rents a house with electricity but no piped water, citing food as her greatest monthly expense.

loans.use: To buy secondhand clothes for adults and children

loans.name: Puit De Jacob Plus Group

texts.en:
Espé M., age 30 and unmarried, is the president of the Community Bank “Puit de Jacob Plus,” which is composed of 21 members united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their businesses. 

Espé started her business in 2000. She sells fresh and salted fish at the market located east of the city of Kinshasa. She is a loyal client of IMF HOPE RDC who has already received six different loans and has repaid them properly. She intends to use the next loan to diversify her business by purchasing some sacks of manioc to make shikwanges, which are a main food in Kinshasa, and resell them with the aim of increasing her profits. Each week, her business brings in a profit of $50.

Her ambition is to open a cold storage facility.

loans.use: diversifying her business by buying some sacks of manioc to make shikwanges and resell them at profit

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Isidro Daniel

texts.es:
El Sr. Isidro  está casado con la Sra. Rumilda hace varios años, tienen 1 hijo menor edad que aún está cursando la escuela primaria.

Juntos montaron una despensa en su casa que esta ubicado  en un barrio muy poblado de la zona, se iniciaron con un pequeño capital que consiguieron con otros trabajos que han realizaron anteriormente como asalariados.

Además de la despensa trabajan con reparto de mercaderías ya que  la zona  está muy poblada y  existen muchos otros pequeños negocios a quienes les proveen de mercaderías.

Gracias al trabajo que están realizando pueden educan a su hijo y compran todas las necesidades básicas de su hogar.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de artículos de primera necesidad como: azúcar en bolsas de 50 kg. Harinas en bolsa de 30 kg. Aceite en tambores de 100 litros y otros productos de primera necesidad.
texts.en:
Isidro has been married to Rumilda for several years. They have one young child who is still in elementary school. Together they opened a store in their home, which is located in a highly populated neighbourhood. They started with a small amount of capital that they obtained through other work that they did previously as wage-earners. On top of the store, they work in goods distribution since their area is highly populated and there are many other small businesses to whom they provide merchandise. Thanks to the work that they are doing they can educate their child and buy all of their basic household necessities. Isidro is requesting this loan for the purchase of staples such as: sugar in bags of 50kg; flour in bags of 30 kg; oil in drums of 100 liters; and other staples.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of sugar, pasta, rice, flour, oil and other staples

loans.name: La Estrella (Flat) Group

texts.es:
Del  grupo la ESTRELLA sus integrantes son:  Marisela (venta de pollo), Maria de los Ángeles (venta de refrescos), Adriana betzabel (venta de cecina), y doña Maria (venta de bisutería).

     De quien vamos a platicar es de Adriana betzabel, ella es hija de la sra. Marisela, como pueden ver son dos mujeres lechones que buscan salir a delante con sus créditos: Adriana cuenta con 23 años de edad, cursó hasta el 3 años de secundaria, es mamá soltera, tiene 1 angelito la cual se llama: Carla Selene de 5 años de edad  a penas va a iniciar el  preescolar, Adriana actualmente vive con sus papás,  poco a poco se a abierto camino,   también a iniciado  su negocio vendiendo  cecina, longaniza y carne enchilada, ella me comenta que le gustaría superarse profesionalmente, prepararse y cursar una carrera técnica en informática para poderle ofrecerle una vida mejor a su hija y para ella… como? Obteniendo un mejor trabajo y más ingresos. Por que con esta oportunidad que tenga va a lograr lo que más anhela, tener su propia casa.

Me comenta que su grupo es muy unido y que le han echado ganas a sus actividades para que no pierdan el beneficio de seguir con los apoyo que  Fundacion Realidad y kiva les han otorgado a su grupo,  también están muy agradecidas y esperan seguir por muchos ciclos mas sus crédito por que sin el no habrían  podido iniciar su negocio.
texts.en:
The members of the Estrella (Star) group are: Marisela (chicken sales); Maria de los Angeles (soft drink sales); Adriana Betzabel (meat jerky sales); and Maria (costume jewelery sales). We are going to talk about Adriana Betzabel. She is the daughter of Marisela, and as we can see they are both novices who are looking to get ahead with their loans. Adriana is 23, did 3 years of high school, is a single mother and has one little angel named Carla Selene, age 5, who is just about to start preschool. Adriana currently lives with her parents, and bit by bit the way is becoming smooth for her. She started her business selling meat jerky, sausage and beef enchiladas. She tells me that she would like to get ahead professionally, learn and start a career in information technology in order to offer her daughter and herself a better life...how? Through obtaining a better job and more income. With this opportunity she will achieve what she most desires: owning her own home. She tells me that her group is very united and that they are doing their best in their activities so that they do not lose the benefits of continued support that Fundacion Realidad and Kiva have offered them. They are also very grateful and hope to continue with many more cycles because without these credits they would not have been able to start their businesses

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of meat jerky and sausage

loans.name: Liza

texts.es:
La  Sra. Liza está  casada con el Sr. Luis desde hace varios años,  ellos viven en Hernandarias.

Liza se dedica a la venta de ropas en forma ambulante, vende ropas masculinas y femeninas. 
Ella se inició hace varios años con un poco mercaderías ya estando casada. De a poco fue aumentando con el pasar de los años. Hoy día ella tiene muchas mercaderías y bien surtidos. Cabe señalar que tiene una clientela  bien formada que le permite progresar. 

Además su marido trabaja en una tabacalera que está cerca de su casa, de esta forma su marido le ayuda con los gastos del hogar.

Ella desea ampliar la disponibilidad de mercaderías para la temporada de invierno por ello solicita el préstamo para la compra de suéter, pantalones, camperas, tapados y otros tipos de abrigos en general.
texts.en:
Liza has been married to Luis for several years. They live in Hernandarias. Liza sells clothing as a street merchant; she sells men's and women's clothing. She started this several years ago, already married, with a little merchandise. Bit by bit she has been expanding with the passing of time. She now has a lot of merchandise and is well-stocked. It should be noted that she has a well-formed customer base that will allow her to progress. Her husband works in a tobacco company near to their home. This way, he helps with the household costs. She wants to expand her availability of winter merchandise, so she is requesting this loan for the purchase of sweaters, pants, jackets, coats and other types of warm clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of sweaters, pants, jumpers, jackets, socks and hats

loans.name: Uganda Youth Microfinance Co-Operation Limited Group, Kampala

texts.en:
O. Joy has been a fruit and vegetable seller for ten years in Lubaga, central-Kampala. This mother of five worked hard with the assistance of close friends to obtain a footing in this increasingly competitive business.

Joy has mostly been selling fruits and vegetables. One cannot go wrong with this kind of business by virtue of the fact that people depend on the foodstuffs in the course of every day. Joy also ekes out profits from a rental business that she runs concurrently.

In a week, Joy makes over 200,000 shillings. With the hard work that she puts in, however, the future looks promisingly rosy. She needs a loan and, with it, she wants to purchase in bulk fresh fruits and vegetables that she will later sell at her stall.

loans.use: To purchase more fruits and vegetables in bulk

loans.name: Exode Plus Group

texts.en:
Exode Plus is a community bank made up of 20 members whose chairwoman is Mireille. These members are united in the same goal: to grow their businesses through loans received from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC.

Mireille runs a restaurant to the north of the city of Kinshasa. She began her business in 2002 with startup capital of $20. After hard work and good management, she succeeded in making the restaurant thrive thanks to her accumulated profits. The business now gives her a profit of $40 per day. She intends to expand it with the next loan by adding soft drinks. Mireille is 36 years old, married and the mother of four children whose ages range from 10 to 20 years old. All of them attend school.

loans.use: diversifying her business by adding soft drinks to resell at profit

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Abdalla

texts.en:
H. is a married man with three children who all attend school. His spouse is a businesswoman who helps with the family's needs. He operates a firewood and charcoal business and sells from home to his neighbors and at the market. With the 30,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) he would like to buy more of the firewood and 10 sacks of charcoal. The major challenge in the business is high costs of transportation and theft cases.

H. hopes to build rental houses and construct a fish pond in the future. He joined Yehu because of availability of financial services and its simple processes. He owns a home with no electricity but with piped water. His greatest monthly expense is school fees.

loans.use: Purchase firewood and charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Fatimata

texts.fr: Madame Fatimata  S. est une jeune femme de 28 ans qui vit dans la localité de Bambilor. Elle est membre de la caisse depuis mars 2010 et elle n’a jamais bénéficié de prêt au sein de l’institution. Elle est marie et mère  d’un enfant de 2 ans. Elle évolue  depuis 3 ans dans l’achat et la vente de légumes (piments, choux, aubergines, etc. Auparavant elle a choisi cette activité  pour ne pas rester inactive. Et ses bénéfices  lui permet de se payer des habits et souvent des bijoux. Elle sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs dans le but de renforcer son activité de commerce de légumes.
texts.en:
Ms. Fatimata S. is a young woman, aged 28, who lives in the Bambilor locality. She has been a member of the local group fund since March 2010, and has not benefited from any loans from the institution so far. She is married and has a 2-year-old child. She has been involved for 3 years in buying and selling vegetables (peppers, cabbages, eggplants, etc.). Originally, she chose this business to keep from being inactive. Also, her profits allow her to pay for her clothes, and often jewelry. She is seeking a loan of 100,000 frs with the goal of strengthening her vegetable-selling business.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her working capital

loans.name: Filemon

texts.es: Filemón, de 66 años, es un hombre muy trabajador y responsable, vive en su casa propia junto a su último hijo, quien lo acompaña y lo ayuda en la chacra. Desde hace 40 años, todas las mañanas, desde muy temprano, Filemón sale a trabajar a su chacra, sabe que tiene que poner todo su esfuerzo en hacer más fértil sus tierras, para poder obtener una buena cosecha. Sus productos los vende en la ciudad de Pichanaki, donde tiene muchos compradores, debido a la buena calidad de sus cultivos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y lo hace con mucho esmero, sin embargo el tener que fumigar sus tierras le es muy peligroso, pero necesita de ello para evitar las plagas para que no afecten la producción. Con el tiempo espera alquilar nuevas tierras, para aumentar su producción. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, en sus primeros pagos fue muy puntual y espera poder serlo ahora también. En su grupo comunal es muy querido por el resto de las socias. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono y fertilizantes para sus tierras, ya que desea que sus chacras estén muy productivas.
texts.en:
Filemón is 66 years old; he is a hardworking and responsible man. He lives in his own home with his youngest son who helps him in the small farm. For some 40 years, Filemón gets up very early every morning and goes to work on his small farm. He knows that he needs to put all of his efforts in making his land more fertile so that he can have a good harvest. His products are sold in the city of Pichanaki, where he has a lot of buyers because of the quality of his crops. What he enjoys most in his work is to sow his land and he does this carefully he also fumigates his land which is very dangerous, but he needs to do it to prevent plagues so that they don’t affect his crop production. With time, he hopes to rent more land to increase production. This is his third loan with MFP (Kiva’s field partner) his first payments were very punctual and he hopes to be able to be the same way again. In his communal group, he is well-liked by the rest of the members. With the 2,000 nuevos soles, he will buy more manure and fertilizer for his lands since he hopes that his small farms will be very productive.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy manure so that his land will be more fertile.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr: Madame Mariama S. est une femme mariée  âgée  de 33 ans qui habite dans la localité de Bambilor. Elle est mère  de 3 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 4 et 10 ans. Elle est societaire de l’institution de l’U-IMCEC  depuis avril 2010. Elle a une expérience  de 10 ans dans le commerce de légumes. Son intention étant  de soutenir son mari dans les charges familiales c’est la raison pour laquelle elle a choisi cette activité. Elle sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs destine a l’achat de légumes  pour ainsi renforcer son activité de commerce. Elle souhaite diversifier les variétés  de légumes  qu’elle commercialise avec les carottes, les oignons, les persils et les piments. Son crédit  peut l’aider selon elle à acquérir  une certaine stabilité financière.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mariama S. is 33 years old, married, and lives in Bambilor. She is the mother of 3 children ranging in age from 4 to 10 years old. She has been a member of the U-IMCEC credit union since April 2010. With 10 years of experience in selling vegetables, she chose this activity in order to support her husband in their household expenses. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 francs to be used for buying vegetables, to increase her sales activity. She wants to increase the range of the vegetables that she sells with carrots, onions, parsley and peppers. According to Mrs. S., her loan will help her to acheive a certain level of financial stability.

Translated from French by Sarah Puchner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase funds

loans.name: Halimatu

texts.en:
Halimatu Y. is married but has no children yet. She has no educational background. Halimatu moves around Abura selling jewelry and cosmetics. Her husband is a driver. 

Halimatu wishes to add the loan she hopes to receive to her initial capital to purchase more jewelry for sale. With the new revenue from her expanded business, Halimatu plans to save to buy a shop to sell in.

loans.use: add to her initial capital to purchase more jewelry for sale

loans.name: Manuela Isabel

texts.es:
Doña Manuela tiene la edad de 40 años, madre de dos hijos, casada, su negocio lo inicio hace varios años, en la venta de tortilla.
Lo inicio con la necesidad de apoyar a su familia ya que todo esta a altos costos y solo con el salario de su esposo no se ajusta ya que es bajo, ya que trabaja como guarda de seguridad.
Poco a poco ha ido mejorando su casa con el crédito anterior logro levantar las paredes del cuarto, pero aun no lo termina por falta de dinero.
Con este préstamo comprara los materiales necesarios para lograr terminarlo ya que falta repello, puertas, ventanas, embaldosar para lograr estar en mejores condiciones.
Comprara: cemento, arena, puertas para comenzar la obra y lograr esta mejora que gracias a estos financiamiento será posible.
texts.en:
Mrs. Manuela is 40 years old, is a mother to two children and is married. She began her business some years ago, selling tortillas.

She began her business with the need to support her family since everything is very expensive and her husbands’ income is not enough for them since it's low, he works as a security guard.

Little by little, she has been improving her home with the previous loan, she was able to put walls in the room but she is still not done because she lacks the money.

With this loan she will buy the necessary materials to finish since she needs to replaster, buy doors, windows, and put tiles, to have her home in better conditions.

She will buy cement, sand, and doors to begin work and to make the improvements since thanks to this loan it will be possible.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy blocks, sand, cement and doors to finish a room.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: José, de 49 años, es un padre de familia muy responsable y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Margarita de 45 años y su hijo menor, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. En el poblado de Zona Patria (Distrito de la provincia de Chanchamayo), se encuentran las chacras de José. Desde muy joven el aprendió esta actividad de sus padres y ahora él tiene sus propias tierras, las cuales con ayuda de su esposa cultiva café y mandarina y debido a la buena calidad de su producción siempre recibe buenas ganancias. Lleva 30 años realizando esta actividad y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus sembríos de plagas que puedan perjudicarlo, sin embargo el tener que transportar sus cultivos siempre le ha sido muy difícil. Mas adelante espera comprar nuevas tierras, en las cuales pueda sembrar más y ampliar su producción. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP y se siente en la capacidad de pagar todas sus cuotas, es uno de los miembros más activos en su grupo comunal, por eso es muy querido y respetado. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará abono y fertilizantes para volver más productiva sus tierras.
texts.en:
José is 49 years old; he is father and is very responsible and hardworking. He lives in his own home with his wife, Margarita who is 45 and his youngest son who are the reason for all of his hard work. His small farms are in the Zona Patria town (District of the province of Chanchamayo). From a very young age he learned this work from his parents and now he has his own lands and with the help of his wife he grows coffee and mandarins. Due to the good quality of his crops he always gets good earnings. For 30 years he has been in this work and what he enjoys most is taking care of his crops from plagues that could harm them, a problem he always has is transporting his harvest. In the future, he hopes to buy new land where he can grow more and increase his crop production. This José’s fourth loan with MFP (Kiva’s field partner) and he feels capable of paying all his quotas and is one of the most active members of his communal group, he is very well-liked and respected. With the 2,000 nuevos pesos, he will buy manure and fertilizers to make his lands more productive.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy manure to improve the production of coffee and mandarins.

loans.name: Jicaltepec Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Jicaltepec, se eligió este nombre para el grupo ya que asi se llama la comunidad donde viven. La historia es acerca de la señora María López garcía, puesto que es una de las integrantes de este grupo. Ella tiene 44 años, esta casada su esposo es albañil, tiene 3 hijos, Leonel, Uriel y Luis ángel los 3 están estudiando, 2 de ellos van a la secundaria y el otro esta cursando el bachillerato, ella se dedica a la venta de antojitos como enchiladas y sopes, también vende tortillas hechas a manos.

María eligió la venta de antojitos por que dice que es una muy buena fuente de ingresos, ella invirtirá su préstamo en la compra de los ingredientes que utiliza para la preparación de la comida como son: leña, maíz, papas, chile poblano, chile verde, jitomates, tomates y queso, también para hacer sus aguas frescas comprará: piña, sandia, melón, naranjas y mangos. 

Su negocio le esta ayudando ahora que viene el termino de clases ya que 2 de sus hijos van a terminar, uno de la secundaria y el otro del bachillerato y con las graduaciones necesita hacer algunos gastos, pues tiene que comprarles zapatos, uniformes, además de las cooperaciones que le están pidiendo en las escuelas, también quiere mejorar su negocio, emparejando el suelo y echarle el piso ya que es de tierra, comprar una lona para usarla como techo en su negocio, sillas y mesas.

Su negocio beneficia mucho a las personas de su comunidad por que asi no tienen que ir tan lejos a comprar su comida y tortillas, ya que algunas personas de su comunidad prefieren comprarla preparada para no tener que estar haciendo en su casa.

La señora María quiere que sus hijos tengan una profesión ya que ella no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, ella esta pensando que aparte de la venta de comida puede vender frutas y verduras ya que en su localidad tienen que ir hasta la ciudad a comprar y es una actividad que no tiene competencia en su comunidad.

Nos comenta que en su grupo se trabaja muy bien , puesto que todas las integrantes se conocen y son muy responsables con sus pagos.

Y estos son los nombres y las actividades que realizan cada una de las integrantes del grupo.
Oralia S. galán – tienda artesanal
Eustolia garcía T. – antojitos
Carmela López M. – antojitos
Sotera garcía S. – antojitos
Juana garcía garcía – abarrotes
María López garcía – cocina económica
Teresa T. Pérez – deposito de refrescos
Rebeca M. garcía – cocina económica
Ricarda S. garcía – antojitos
Ofelia S. M. – antojitos
Eustolia V. Pérez – cocina económica 
Margarita Pérez López – antojitos 
Francisca M. – chiles y semillas
texts.en:
This group is called Jicaltepec, named after the community where they live. The story is about Ms. María López García, since she is one of the members of this group. She is 44 years old, married to a construction worker, and has three school-aged children: Leonel, Uriel and Luis Angel, two of whom are studying in secondary school and one in high school. She makes and sells traditional corn-based Mexican dishes such as enchiladas, soups and pastas, and also hand-made tortillas. María says she chose home-made food sales as her business because it is a very good source of income. She will invest her loan in the purchase of the ingredients she uses to prepare the food which are: firewood, corn, potatoes, poblano and green chiles, jitomates, tomatoes and cheese. She will also buy ingredients for her “aguas frescas” (light fruit juices): pineapple, watermelon, other melons, oranges and mangoes. Her business is helping now that the end of classes is near since two of her children are going to graduate, one from secondary school and the other from high school, and she will have some graduation expenses for them such as shoes and uniforms as well as the donations they are soliciting at the schools. She would also like to improve her business, leveling out the ground and putting in some flooring since it is a dirt floor, and to buy a canvas to use as a roof for her business, and tables and chairs. Her business provides a real benefit to the people in her community because now they do not have to travel so far to buy their food and tortillas, given that some people in her community prefer to buy prepared food so as not to have to cook at home. María wants her children to have a profession since she herself did not have the opportunity to study for one. She is thinking that in addition to selling prepared food she can sell fruits and vegetables since in her area people have to travel to the city to buy produce and there would be no competition for that business in her neighborhood. She mentions that her group works together very well, since all the members know each other and are very responsible with their payments. And these are the names and business activities each one of the members carries out: Oralia S. Galán – Traditional crafts shop Eustolia García T. – Food preparation Carmela López M. – Food preparation Sotera García S. – Food preparation Juana García García – Groceries María López García – Home-style restaurant Teresa T. Pérez – Soda pop and other non-alcoholic drinks Rebeca M. garcía – Home-style restaurant Ricarda S. garcía – Food preparation Ofelia S. M. – Food preparation Eustolia V. Pérez – Home-style restaurant Margarita Pérez López – Food preparation Francisca M. – Chiles and seeds

Translated from Spanish by Margaret Wolfe-Roberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase firewood, corn, potatoes, poblano and green chiles, jitomates, tomatoes and cheese

loans.name: Sirena

texts.en:
Sirena is a widow with two grown daughters. She lives in Beregovo, Western Ukraine and sells different retail items in the central marketplace of her home town. Sirena sells ceramics, artificial flowers and women's clothing. She owns a small vending facility which is located in a favorable spot, always busy with dozens of customers. Sirena has been in the retail business for 6 years. Currently, she has 12,000 Grivnyas invested in inventory. Her net profit amounts to 4,000 Grivnyas. 

Sirena is seeking a 6,000 Grivnya loan to purchase additional merchandise and increase her turnover capital as a result. Sirena's husband died many years ago and her children moved to Hungary. She keeps this business to support herself. Moreover, Sirena says the venture keeps her moving and living a more active life which has always been her goal. She doesn't like being retired and sitting in one spot. Sirena is a serious entrepreneur with a responsible approach to lending assistance. She always tries to be prompt with her payments.

loans.use: to increase her turnover capital

loans.name: Ivanna

texts.en:
Ivanna is married with a 3-year-old son and a 7-year-old daughter. She is a market vendor in Ivano-Frankivsk. Ivanna sells retail children's clothing items in the central city marketplace. Her vending kiosks are well-known among parents as they always boast the best assortment of merchandise for babies and toddlers at affordable prices. Ivanna launched this business 5 years ago on the advice of her mother-in-law. Presently, she has about 5,000 Grivnyas in income every month.  

Ivanna is requesting a 7,500 Grivnya loan to purchase 100 underpads, 100 baby crawler pants, 100 matinee coats and 50 pajamas. Ivanna seeks to see her business grow and develop. She has a hired employee which is one more reason for her to keep her enterprise sustainable and running efficiently. Ivanna likes the idea of providing one more family with stable income and tries to ensure competitive pay for her employee. Ivanna is hoping to invest her  income in the remodeling of her house which is in its final stages.

loans.use: to purchase additional children's clothing merchandise

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi T. sells crates of eggs at Abura.  Esi has received junior high education.  She is a single parent who takes care of three children. She provides the needs of her children with the income she makes from her sales. Her loan will be used to buy additional crates of eggs to be able to also supply to those customers who demand a larger quantity. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to build a store house where she can keep the eggs.

loans.use: buy additional crates of eggs

loans.name: Ruslana

texts.en:
Ruslana is married with a teenage daughter. She is a clothing sales entrepreneur selling children's merchandise in the central marketplace of Ivano-Frankivsk called "Trayan". Ruslana has been in this business for 12 years. Her monthly net profit amounts to 4,000 Grivnyas. 

Ruslana is seeking a 5,000 Grivnya loan to purchase 50 jackets, 30 caps, 100 crawler pants and 50 baby underpads. This business is the main source of income for the family. One of the short-term plans Ruslana has is to open one more vending location in her home town, thus expanding her trade and increasing her income.

loans.use: to purchase additional clothing merchandise

loans.name: Lucerito Group

texts.es:
Este es el grupo Lucerito el cual esta conformado por diez mujeres con deseos de superarse y salir adelante, un grupo en el que todas tienen decisiones propias ya que cada integrante se siente bien formando parte de Lucerito. Ellas se ubican en la Colonia San Miguel Xico 3ª sección Valle de Chalco, Estado de México. Este grupo lleva su tercer ciclo y espera poder seguir estando en Fundación Realidad por más tiempo, ya que el apoyo es muy beneficioso para ellas.

Ángela D. O. es integrante del grupo. Tiene 74 años de edad, ella es viuda desde hace seis años, tiene cuatro hijos los cuales ya están casados. Desde muy chica comenzó a trabajar ya que sus padres no le dieron la oportunidad de estudiar porque tenia que cuidar a sus demás hermanos. Ella comenzó con una pequeña tienda en la que su esposo le ayudaba, cuando ella quedo viuda tuvo que cerrar la tienda por que no contaba con la ayuda de nadie para seguir surtiendo su mercancía, tiempo después decidió comenzar con la venta de Chiles secos, Hojas de plátano, canela, nueces, etc. Ya que considera que es una actividad en la no tiene que hacer mucho esfuerzo. Ángela abre desde las diez de la mañana  y cierra a las cuatro de la tarde, para después poder entregar sus pedidos con las vecinas de su localidad. Ella desea poner nuevamente una tienda y poder contratar a alguien para que le ayude con sus ventas.
 
Con este crédito quiere comprar hojas de plátano y de maíz para tamales ya que en estas fechas son las que mas se le venden y poder comprar mercancía de primera calidad para tener una mejor clientela.

Los demás integrantes de este grupo son:  
Julia Martínez Hernández (Venta de Frutas y Verduras)                           
Asunción Graciela R. Ramírez (Venta de productos Naturistas)
Ernestina Ramírez Méndez (Venta de Ropa)                        
Jessica Vázquez Hernández (Venta de Ropa)    
María Antonia R. Ramírez (Venta de Antojitos Mexicanos)       
Iris Violeta O. S. (Taller de Costura)
Francisca Hernández T. (Estética)
María del Carmen Gonzáles M. (Venta de Zapatos y Lencería por catalogo) 
Leticia Vázquez Hernández (Taller de Bicicletas)
texts.en:
This is the Lucerito group, made up of 10 women looking to better themselves and succeed. In this group every member makes her own decisions since they are all comfortable being a part of Lucerito. The are from the San Miguel Xico 3ra Seccion neighborhood of Valle de Chalco, State of Mexico. This group is in their third cycle and hope to remain in Fundacion Realidad since the support has been helpful to them. Group member Angela D. O. is 74, widowed 6 yeas ago, and has four married children. She started working from a very young age as her parents were unable to give her the chance to study since she had to care for her other siblings. She started out with a small store where her husband helped out, though she had to close the store when she was widowed since she didn't have help stocking the store. Some time later she began selling dried chilies, plantain leaves, cinnamon, nuts and others since this is a relatively low intensity activity. Angela opens at 10 in the morning and closes at 4 pm so that she can deliver her orders to her neighbors in the area. Angela would like to re-open her store and hire someone to help with sales. With this loan she hopes to buy plantain and corn leaves for tamales, since this is the time of year they sell best, and also be able to buy top quality product to improve her customer base. The other group members are as follows: Julia M. H. (fruit and vegetable sales) Asuncion Graciela R. R. (macrobiotic sales) Ernestina Ramírez Méndez (clothing sales) Jessica Vázquez Hernández (clothing sales) María Antonia R. Ramírez (traditional mexican snacks) Iris Violeta O. S. (sewing workshop) Francisca Hernández T. (beauty services) María del Carmen Gonzáles M. (catalog based shoe and lingerie sales) Leticia Vázquez Hernández (bicycle shop)

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase dried chilies, hot peppers, plantain and corn leaves, nuts, cumin, pepper

location.town: Valle De Chalco Solidaridad  Estado De Mexico

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en:
Yelena is divorced with a grown son. She is an entrepreneur from Novomoskovsk. Yelena sells toys and children's merchandise in a small vending pavilion at the central market of her home town. She can boast the character of a hard worker and positive thinker. Yelena has been in this business for 4 years. Presently, she has 30,000 Grivnyas invested in merchandise. Her income is about 10,000 Grivnyas a month. 

Yelena is requesting a loan of 8,200 Grivnyas to purchase additional merchandise and boost her sales this summer. She also works as an elementary school teacher. However, her tiny salary of 900 Grivnyas can hardly help her family survive which is why she was forced to launch a small vending venture. Yelena's teaching experience has helped her better learn children's mentality and psychology, as well as inculcated a love for children in her. We believe Yelena will make good use of the current loan and repay it promptly.

loans.use: to purchase inventory

loans.name: Maritza Elizabeth

texts.es:
Maritza de 44 años, vive en la Primavera de Duran (perímetro urbano fue originalmente irregular, con varios cerros, riachuelos y lagunas que aún se presentan como restos de una ecología en disolución). Ella tiene una papelería. 

Para poder solventar los gastos familiares ella tuvo que invertir sus ahorros, ya que su esposo como es chofer trabajaba viajando a las provincias del Ecuador y no pasaba en casa. Compro cuadernos, papelería y artículos. Poco a poco con esfuerzo a podido agrandar mas su negocio, Trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 19h00pm. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cuadernos y mochilas para su loca. En el futuro quiere surtir mas su negocio con nuevos productos.
texts.en:
Maritza is 44 and lives in Primavera de Duran (Duran is an area on the edge of the city that once had hills, streams, and small lakes. These can still be seen as remains of a deteriorating environment). She has a stationary store. To be able to cover the household expenses, she had to invest her savings since her husband, a chauffeur, would work traveling to the provinces of Ecuador and wouldn't come back through the house. She purchased notebooks, stationary, and paper items. Little by little with effort, she has been able to expand her business. She works from 8 am until 7 pm. She wants to use the loan to invest in notebooks and backpacks for her store. In the future, she wants to stock her business with new products.

Translated from Spanish by Rachael Mossey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase notebooks and backpacks

loans.name: Maria Rosario

texts.es: La solicitante cuenta con 2 años de experiencia en confeccion de casacas y polos al por mayor y menor. La cliente desea incrementar su negocio tiene 2 maquinas industriales y mas adelante desearia trabajar con personal y poder realizar su sueño de contar con su propio taller. Solicita el prestamo para compra de materia prima (telas) e  insumos
texts.en:
The applicant has 2 years of experience making jackets and polos wholesale and retail. The customer wishes to increase her business and has 2 industrial machines and later wishes to work with staff and be able to make her dream come true of having her own workshop. She needs the loan to buy raw material (fabrics) and supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials and supplies.

loans.name: Puerta Del Cielo Group

texts.es:
EL GRUPO SE LLAMA  “PUERTA DEL CIELO” ESTA INTEGRADO DE TRES SEÑORAS, LA RAZON POR EL CUAL LE DIERON ESE NOMBRE ES POR UN CAMINO LEJANO LLAMADO ASI. 
DOÑA  ANTONIA H.  L. ES ORIGINARIA DE LA COLONIA JUAN SABINES MUNICIPIO DE COPAINALA CHIAPAS, ELLA SE ENTERO DEL PROGRAMA POR PERSONAS DE SU COLONIA EL CUAL LE INTERESO MUCHO.

ANTONIA H., FORMO ESTE GRUPO CON SU COMADRE MARGARITA G. R. Y DOÑA MARIA MARLENE G. H. QUIENES TIENEN ACTIVIDADES DIFERENTES. 

ELLA SOLICITO EL PRESTAMO PARA COMPRAR COCOS Y VENDERLO EN AGUA DE HORCHATA, DONDE NECESITA INGREDIENTES COMO: AZUCAR, LECHE Y CANELA, PARA PREPARARLO.TAMBIEN CUENTA CON EL APOYO DE SU ESPOSO DON REY DAVID VAZQUEZ FARELO QUIEN SE EN CARGA DE  SALIR A VENDERLO.

 LA SEGUNDA INTEGRANTE DEL GRUPO, MARGARITA G. R.  QUIEN SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE ROPA, COMO SON: PANTALONES, PLAYERAS, BLUSAS Y CAMISAS, ENTRE OTROS. Y SU COMPAÑERA LA SEÑORA MARIA MARLENE G. H. EN EL COMERCIO DE PRODUCTOS AGRICOLAS.

 DOÑA ANTONIA SE SIENTE FELIZ Y CONTENTA YA QUE LE A BENEFICIADO MUCHO EN LA COMPRA DE MAS PRODUCTO.
 COMENTA LA SEÑORA ANTONIA QUE HASTA EL MOMENTO NO HA TENIDO NINGUNA DIFICULTAD YA QUE SU ESPOSO SE VA A VENDERLO EN EL PARQUE DE COPAINALA CHIAPAS QUE  QUEDA A CINCO MINUTOS DE LA COLONIA DONDE ELLA VIVE.

SU SUEÑO MAS HERMOSO ES SEGUIR TRABAJANDO CON EL CREDITO, AHORRAR Y TENER LO NECESARIO PARA APOYAR A SUS NIETOS EN SUS ESTUDIOS.
texts.en:
The Puerta del Cielo ("Heaven's Gate") group is made up of three women, who have called their group after a road of the same name. Antonia H. L. comes from the Juan Sabines district in the town of Copinala Chiapas. She was very interested when she heard about the programme from people in her neighbourhood. Antonia H. formed the group with her god-daughter, Margarita G. R., and Maria Marlene G. H.. Each of the three are in diifferent lines of work. Antonia is seeking the loan to buy coconuts, to sell along with horchata (a local soft drink), for which she needs ingredients such as sugar, milk and cinnamon. She will also have the support of her husband, David Vazquez Farelo, who will go out and sell them. The second member of the group, Margarita G. R., sells clothes, including trousers, T-shirts, shirts and blouses among other things. The third member of the group, Maria Marlene G. H., sells agricultural supplies. Antonia is happy and content that she has already benefited by investing in products such as these. She says there has been no difficulty with her husband going out and selling them in the park in Copinala Chiapas, which is just five minutes from their home. Her most treasured dream is to keep working with this loan, and save up so she can help her grandchildren through school.

Translated from Spanish by Rosa Oswald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy coconuts and ingredients such as sugar, milk and cinnamon

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es: Lucia, de 40 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y alegre, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 4 queridos hijos y lo que más desea es brindarles una mejor vida. En los verdes campos del poblado de Zona Patria (Distrito de la provincia de Chanchamayo), Lucia tiene sus cultivos de café, en donde se dedica a sus plantas todas las mañanas sin importarle las condiciones del clima, puesto que es su única fuente de ingresos para su familia. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar sus tierras y lo hace con mucho esmero, lleva 25 años de experiencia y considera que lo más difícil es cuidarlos de las plagas, ya que a veces lo perjudican en la producción. Con el tiempo, desea comprar más tierras para ampliar su  producción. Este es el sexto crédito con MFP y esta ahorrando para pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a sus compañeras de su grupo comunal, donde se siente muy contenta. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más fertilizantes para proteger sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Lucia is 40 years old; she is a hardworking and cheerful woman. She lives in her own home with her 4 loving children and what she wishes for most is to give them a better quality of life. In the green fields of the Zona Patria town (District province of Chanchamayo), Lucia has her coffee crops. Every morning despite weather conditions she takes care of her plants since it is the only source of income for her family. What she enjoys most is working her land and she does it very carefully. Lucia has 25 years of experience and considers that the most difficult part is protecting the crops from plagues since they hurt production. In the future, she hopes to buy more land to increase production. This is her sixth loan with MFP (Kiva’s field partner) and is saving to pay her quotas on time since she does not want to cause problems to the other members of her communal bank, where she is very happy. With the 1,500 nuevos soles, she will buy more fertilizers to protect her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertlizers to protect her coffee crops.

loans.name: Mariya

texts.en:
Mariya is married with a daughter. She sells women's outer wear and footwear in Beregovo, Westen Ukraine. Mariya owns a nice, spacious vending kiosk in her home town. Her place is often busy with customers who like to come and buy from her, attracted by the welcoming atmosphere and affordable prices. Mariya started her business 6 years ago. Presently, she has 40,000 Grivnyas worth of inventory. Her net profit amounts to 3,500 Grivnyas. 

Mariya is requesting a loan of 7,000 Grivnyas to purchase seasonal merchandise for her kiosk. She is planning to offer a better selection of summer clothing items that always sell well this season when many Ukrainians go on vacation to the seaside. Mariya is a responsible entrepreneur and borrower. She has a good credit history and her previous loans were repaid without delinquencies.

loans.use: to increase her turnover capital

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en:
Gifty is very welcoming. She is 58 years old and sells building materials, assorted paints, nails, carpentry tools, door fixtures etc. to customers in her neighborhood in Kumasi. Gifty has been operating her trade for six years and is eager to be taking out this loan. She plans to use this loan to add the sale of plywood to expand her product line. It is the dream of almost every Ghanaian to own his house which makes selling building materials profitable. Gifty believes in customer care and her broad smile almost always draws customers to her shop, making her one of the successful traders in these products.

Gifty is married to a man who is an auto mechanic and together they have five children from age 9 – 29 years. She says that she dreams of being able to generate enough profit that she will be able to support her children to achieve higher education.

loans.use: To purchase plywood for resale

loans.name: Los Pinos (Flat) Group

texts.es:
EL GRUPO SE LLAMA LOS PINOS ESTA INTEGRADO DE TRES PERSONAS QUE SON LAS SEÑORAS: FLOR DE LUZ P. P., MAGDALI PATRCIO E. Y MARINA E. P., CADA UNA CON DIFERENTES ACTIVIDADES, LAS INTEGRANTES SE ENTERARON DEL PROGRAMA POR LOS ANUNCIOS Y COORDINADORES.
DOÑA  MARINA E. P., ES ORIGINARIA DE COAPILLA, CHIAPAS TIENE 72 AÑOS DE EDAD SE CASO  A LOS 18 AÑOS, CON EL SEÑOR PEDRO P. P., DE LA MISMA LOCALIDAD Y TIENE 7 HIJOS TODOS CASADOS.
EL MOTIVO POR EL CUAL DOÑA MARINA SOLICITO EL PRESTAMO ES PARA COMPRAR LOS INGREDIENTES Y ELABORACION DE  PANES YA QUE PARA REALIZARLO NECESITA LO SIGUIENTE, HARINA, ACEITE, HUEVO, LECHE, ROYAL, AZUCAR, ENTRE OTROS,  Y A UN ASI TAMBIEN CUENTA CON EL APOYO DE SU ESPOSO QUE TRABAJA EN EL CAMPO.
LA ACREDITADA MARINA ESTA MUY CONTENTA CON EL SERVICIO QUE LE BRINDA FUNDACION REALIDAD A. C. 
SU SUEÑO DE DOÑA MARINA E. P., ES AHORRAR PARA SEGUIR CON SU TRABAJO EN LA CUAL COMENTA QUE SU ILUSIÓN ES IRSE A “CANCUN QUINTANA ROO”  Y TENER SU NEGOCIO HASTA QUE DIOS LE PRESTE VIDA.
LAS OTRAS DOS INTEGRANTES UTILIZARÁN SU CRÉDITO PARA: LA SEÑORA FLOR DE LUZ P. P., EN LA COMPRA DE CREMAS, PERÓXIDO, TINTES Y CARRETES PARA SU ESTETICA, Y SU COMPAÑERA MAGDALI P. E., EN SU NEGOCIO DE TAQUERIA.
texts.en:
The Pines Group is composed of 3 women; Flor de Luz, Magdali, and Marina, each pursuing different activities. The members learned about the loan program from announcements and from the coordinators. Marina is originally from Coapilla, Chiapas, 72 years old, and married since the age of 18 to Pedro from the same locality. They have 7 children, all married now. Marina's motive for requesting a loan is to buy ingredients and make bread to sell. To do this, she needs wheat flour, cooking oil, eggs, milk, yeast, and sugar, plus other items. She can count on the help of her husband who works in the countryside. Marina is very content with the service offered by the Fundacion Realidad (Reality Foundation). Her dream is to save in order to continue with her work. Her 'illusion' is to travel to Cancun in Quintana Roo, and to keep her business until God takes her life. The other 2 group members will utilize the loan as follows: Flor de Luz will buy creams, peroxide, hair coloring, and rollers for her beauty shop. Her companion Magdali will use the loan to supply her taco shop.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING INGREDIENTS TO MAKE BREADS (SUGAR, EGGS, FLOUR, YEAST, OIL, AND MILK), AND OTHER SUPPLIES FOR 3 BUSINESSES

loans.name: Sharifa

texts.en: Sharifa I. sells dresses and panties at Abura. She is single and has gained junior high education. With the little money she makes as profit on her business, she takes care of herself. Her loan will be used to buy more dresses and panties to expand her business. She hopes to save the new earnings from her business to buy a shop.

loans.use: to buy more dresses and panties to expand her business

loans.name: Mykola

texts.en:
Mykola is married. He lives and runs his transportation services business in Ivano-Frankivsk, Western Ukraine. Mykola is a hard worker. He works day shifts during during the week and night shifts on weekends. Mykola has a degree in geophysics but couldn't find a job after graduation from college so started this venture. Mykola has been in this business for 4 years. His monthly income amounts to 4,000 Grivnyas. 

Mykola is seeking a 6,000 Grivnyas loan to purchase a compressed gas vehicle equipment set that works on liquefied propane. This improvement will help him cut down on his refueling costs. His business is the main source of income for his family. Mykola is hoping to buy his own house after he saves up enough to afford it.

loans.use: to purchase a compressed gas vehicle equipment set

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila is divorced with two grown children. She is retired but still runs a small business selling women's clothing like dresses, knitted wear and suits in the central marketplace of Novomoskovsk. Ludmila studied commerce in college which helps her in her practical day-to-day dealings with customers and suppliers. She has been in the market for two years. Presently, Ludmila has 30,000 Grivnyas in inventory. 

Ludmila is seeking a loan of 7,500 Grivnyas to purchase additional merchandise and develop her business. She is hoping to re-stock her inventory for the summer season. Ludmila broke her leg two months ago but didn't withdraw from her usual business routine. She has a very persistent and strong personality.She has a good reputation in the market.

loans.use: to grow her business

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es: Marcelina, de 40 años, es una madre de familia muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Felipe de 49 años y sus 6 hijos menores, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. A través de estos años Marcelina ha trabajado muy duro para que sus cultivos sean de muy buena calidad, todas las mañanas con la ayuda de su esposo, trabaja sus tierras, para que sean mas productivas. El café que cultiva, lo vende en el mercado de la ciudad de “La Merced”, ya que es ahí donde le ofrecen mejores precios. Disfruta mucho de la cosecha, es así que se ha mantenido durante 3 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus cultivos, hasta los mercados donde los vende. Con el tiempo, espera poder sembrar todas sus tierras, para poder incrementar su producción. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP y quiere pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que desea acceder a más préstamos en el futuro. Sabe que en su grupo comunal la apoyaran y la guiaran, ya que es una compañera muy querida. Con los dos mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará abono para mejorar la productividad de sus chacras.
texts.en:
Marcelina is 40 years old and a mother to a very happy and hardworking family. She lives in her own home with her husband Felipe (49 years old) and their 6 underage children whom she wishes to give a better quality of life. Throughout these years, Marcelina has worked very hard so that her crops will be of very good quality and every morning with the help of her husband she works the land so that it is more productive. She grows coffee and sells it in the market in the city of “La Merced” since they offer the best prices. She enjoys the harvest and has worked for 3 years, she says that the most difficult thing is transporting her crops to the markets where she sells them. With time she hopes to be able to sow all of her land to be able to increase production. This is her sixth loan with MFP (Kiva’s field partner) and wants to pay her quotas on time since she wishes to get more loans in the future. She knows that her communal group will support and guide her since she is a very well-liked member. With the 2,500 nuevos soles, she will buy manure to improve the productivity of her small farms.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy manure to improve productivity.

loans.name: Las Nubecitas Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama las Nubecitas y se forma de tres mujeres, Urema, Bellarmina y Teresa.
Doña Teresa, vive en la ribera “Julian Grajales” municipio de Copainala, Chiapas. La comunidad es conocida como “San Antonio”. Ella está casada con el señor Oscar desde hace 14 años, con quien  procreo un hijo que cursa el segundo grado de primaria. Ella está feliz y contenta por tener una buena familia.
La razón por la cual solicita el préstamo es para poner su tienda de abarrotes y  comprar mercancía como son: frijol, azúcar, aceite, huevo, harina, galletas, leche,  jabón entre otros. Así poder trabajar y apoyar a su esposo en los gastos de la casa ya que trabaja fuera de la localidad como radio técnico.
Las otras dos integrantes más utilizan su préstamo en otra actividad como doña Bellarmina en la compra de marranos, y Urema también en su tienda de abarrotes.
Su mayor anhelo de la señora teresa es que su negocio crezca día a día en donde pueda trabajar y ser dependiente de la misma. Como también ver a su hijo crecer con buenos principios de educación y buen futuro.
texts.en:
This group is called "Las Nubecitas" (The Little Clouds), and is made up of three women, Urema, Bellarmina and Teresa. Doña Teresa lives on the “Julian Grajales” shore in the municipality of Copainala, Chiapas. The community is known as “San Antonio”. Doña Teresa has been married to Sr. Oscar for 14 years; together they have one son, who is in 2nd grade. She is happy and pleased to have a good family. She is requesting the loan in order to open a grocery store and purchase merchandise, such as: beans, sugar, oil, eggs, flour, cookies, milk, soap and other items. In this way, she will be able to work and to help her husband with the household expenses. He works outside their neighborhood as a radio electronics technician. The other two members use their loans in other businesses. Doña Bellarmina uses hers to purchase pigs, and Urema also uses hers for a grocery store. Sra. Teresa's greatest wish is that her business grows each day and be a place where she can work as the clerk. She also wants to see her son grow with a good start to his education and a have good future.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of merchandise: sugar, beans, oils, eggs, milk, soap, and other items.

loans.name: El Fortin (Flat) Group

texts.es:
La señora Deilery tiene 32 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposo desde hace 8 años,  el señor Simón Altunar Ríos,  su familia se conforma de cuatro hijos, José Francisco quien estudia el segundo grado de secundaria, Rubiel Alejandro de quinto grado de primaria, Viridiana y Jonathan de ocho años, Deliry nos dice: “Me siento muy feliz por el hogar que tiene y los hijos que “Dios” le ha dado”
Ella junto con otras personas se enteraron que Fundación Realidad brindaba créditos a las personas que tuvieran un negocio, así que decidieron formar un grupo y lo llamaron El Fortín, la razón por la cual le dieron ese nombre fue porque el camino que lleva a su comunidad se llama así. Sus compañeras que hoy forman parte del grupo son: Rossana Isabel P., Maria Aroly Z. S. en la que cada una tiene una actividad diferente.
 La señora Deilery cuenta con su negocio de: venta de tamales, sandwich, refrescos, papas fritas, entre otros, ella lleva un año con éste negocio y vende en una escuela primaria llamada “Justo Sierra”.
Ella solicita el crédito a Fundación Realidad A.C. Es para comprar mercancía y tener surtida su tienda así como también Doña Rossana en su negocio de antojitos y Maria Aroly  la venta de traste. Ella comenta que le va muy bien en su negocio, ya que le ha ayudado a solventar los gastos de la casa obteniendo ganancias para ayudar a su esposo en los gastos de la casa, ya que el señor Simón (su esposo) trabaja de ayudante de albañil, él se siente contento y satisfecho con el apoyo que le da a su esposa, pues cree en la igualdad de género.
“Mi sueño es construir un local y con las ganancias de mi negocio seguir apoyando a mis hijos en sus estudios de manera  que tenga más oportunidades de seguir estudiando y tener mejor futuro”
texts.en:
Deilery is 32 years old, and lives with her common-law husband of 8 years, Símon. Her family consists of four children, José Francisco who is in the second grade of secondary school, Rubiel Alejandro who is in the fifth grade of elementary school, and Viridiana and Jonathon who are 8 years old. Delilery tells us: "I feel very happy on account of the home that I have and the four children that God has given me." She, along with other people, found out that Fundación Realidad offered loans to people who have businesses, and so they decided to form a group that they called El Fortín. The reason that they gave themselves this name is that the road that goes to their community is called that. Her friends who make up the rest of the group are: Rossana Isabel and María Aroly, and each has a different business. Deilery runs a business that sells tamales, sandwiches, sodas, fries, and other things. She has been running the business for one year and sells her goods in the Justo Sierra elementary school. She is requesting a loan from Fundación Realidad A.C. to buy stocks for her store, as is Rossana for her snack store, and María Aroly who sells cooking utensils. She comments that her business is going very well, and it has helped her to make a profit and to help her husband with the household expenses. Simón (her husband) works as a mason's assistant, he feels happy and satisfied with the support he gives his wife because he believes in gender equality. "My dream is to build my own place and, with the profits from my business, to support my children in their studies so that they have more opportunities to study and will have a better future."

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ingredients to make tamales, sandwiches, pies. Also to buy sodas, fries, and other goods.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Petty trading like the sale of groceries is widespread in Ghana because it is easy to start up. It usually begins with table-top selling and then grows to become a kiosk and eventually may become a supermarket. Georgina is an entrepreneur who has been trading in groceries such as washing powder, bottled water, canned foods, rice, cooking oil, toiletries, etc for the past 3 and a half years. 

Georgina, 58 years old, is a widow and the mother of three children from age 26-36. She is hoping that she will be able to expand her business and make more income to help her grown children. She is excited to be taking the loan which she plans to invest in purchasing groceries in bulk to serve her customers. 

Georgina believes in customer care and her broad smile almost always draws customers to her shop, making her one of the most successful traders in groceries. She also sells water to households. She anticipates increasing her profit level and also expanding her market.

loans.use: To purchase groceries in bulk.

loans.name: Fidencio

texts.es: Fidencio V. y su esposa desde hace 5 años tiene un negocio de abarrotes llamado “El Molino” y para incrementar sus ganancias ellos se dedican a la venta nixtamal este es utilizado para hacer tortillas, gorditas o tamales. De este negocio es como pagan los gastos de su vivienda y la educación de sus dos hijos. El señor Fidencio requiere de un préstamo para colocar losa en su vivienda para ofrecer a sus hijos confort y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Fidencio V. and his wife of 5 years have a grocery store called “El Molino” and to increase their earnings, they sell nixtamal (a brand of corn flour) which is used to make tortillas, gorditas or tamales. This business helps them pay the household expenses as well as the education of their 2 children. Mr. Fidencio needs the loan to put tile in his home and to provide his children comfort and a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To put tile in a room.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is 46 years old and sells bales of used clothes to customers in Kumasi. Gladys has been operating her trade for eleven years and is eager to be taking out this loan. She plans to use this loan to purchase bales of assorted used clothes for adults and children to meet customers’ demand. Gladys believes in customer care and her broad smile almost always draws customers to her shop, making her one of the successful traders in used clothes. Used clothes are most patronized since brand-new ones are expensive for the ordinary person. This has created a market for women like Gladys.

Gladys is divorced and she is the mother of an 11-month-old baby. She hopes that her child will become a physician. She says that she dreams of being able to generate enough profit so that she will be able to have a container shop to sell her stock out of.

loans.use: To purchase used clothes in bulk.

loans.name: Mario Alberto

texts.es:
La persona que aparece en la foto es la esposa del señor.
Mario Alberto P. G. es un hombre trabajador dispuesto a  ofrecer a su familia una mejora calidad de vida. Desde hace varios años el obtuvo una casa de interés social a la cual le ha ido haciendo mejoras poco a poco; este sacrificio que el hace es para darles una mejor comodidad a sus 2 hijos junto con su esposa. El proyecto que el tiene es levantar un barda en la parte de enfrente para dar seguridad a su familia.
Mario trabaja en una maquiladora en el día y de noche trabaja en taxi para así obtener más ingresos y así suplir los gastos es por ello que no aparece en la imagen.
texts.en:
The person that appears in the photo is the wife of the man.

Mario Alberto P. G. is a hardworking man set to offer his family a better quality of life. For some years he got a house which he has been fixing little by little, the sacrifices that he does are to provide his 2 children and wife a more convenient living environment. The project that he has is to make a fence for the front of his home to provide security to his family.

Mario works in a maquiladora (factory/assembly plant) in the day and during the night he works in a taxi to have more income and to meet the household expenses, that is why he is not in the picture.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a fence.

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es: Marcelino, de 41 años, es un padre de familia muy amoroso y responsable, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Dominica de 36 años y sus dos menores hijos, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Con mucho esfuerzo Marcelino ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia, trabajando arduamente en sus cultivos de plátano y café procurando que sean de muy buena calidad, ya que de eso depende para que la compra de estos productos sea más rápida. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras, sin embargo debe cuidar de sus cultivos de las plagas que perjudican la mayoría de las veces de sus cultivos. Con el tiempo espera comprar nuevas tierras, para incrementar su producción.
