Now she has her own land that she cultivates and tends to with love and patience. She plants peas, potatoes, olluco [a root vegetable] and barley which she sells at the wholesale market in Tarma. What she enjoys most about her work is harvesting her crops, since that is when she is rewarded for all her effort. She has been doing this for 20 years and says that the hardest part of tending to her crops are the potential plagues. Her wish is to buy more land so she can expand her production. This is her sixth loan with MFP and she knows and is willing to make he payments on time. Within her community group she is know for being a good a good partner who is always happy and in a good mood at meetings. With the two thousand Nuevos Soles she is requesting she will buy fertilizer for her lands so that she will have a bountiful harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more fertilizer to have a bountiful harvest

loans.name: Juana Elena

texts.es:
Doña Juana vive en el barrio Villa Reconciliación, madre de cuatro hijos, es una mujer aun con deseo de seguir trabajando, tiene 61 años de edad,  y su negocio es la costura, vende fritanga por las tardes, y los fines de semana hace nacatamales para lograr vender y obtener mejores ingresos.
Durantes años ha trabajado en fabrica de ropa, al jubilarla fue que comenzó a trabajar en su pequeña casa, muy sencilla, y lo que desea hacer es cambiar el techo ya que esta en mal estado. Que cuando llueve se moja y se le hace muy incomodo.
Comprara zinc, clavos y madera para hacer el cambio del techo  y poder lograr vivir en mejores condiciones. Que gracias a los financiamientos ha logrado poder invertir en su negocio como mejorar su pequeña casa.
texts.en:
Mrs. Juana lives in the Villa Reconciliación neighborhood, she is a mother to four children and she wishes to continue working, she is 61 years old. She works as a seamstress and sells fried foods in the evenings and during the weekends she makes tamales to keep selling and have better earnings.

For some years she worked in a clothing factory and once retired she began working in her small home. Her house is very plain and she wants to change the roof since it is in a bad state, when it rains she gets wet and it is very uncomfortable.

She will buy zinc, nails and lumber to change the roof and to be able to live in better conditions. Thanks to the loans she has been able to invest in her business as well as improve her small home.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy zinc, nails and lumber to change the roof since it is in a bad state, and wants to live better.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase creams, lotions, make-up, shampoo

loans.name: Hermenegildo

texts.es: Hermenegildo, de 57 años, es un hombre muy responsable y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a esposa Matilde de 57 años y su querido hijo que aún es menor de edad, quien lo ayuda en sus cultivos. Los años le han enseñado a Hermenegildo a trabajar muy duro, si quiere que sus cultivos sean los mejores de su poblado y es así que con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado que sus sembríos de papa, arveja, habas, olluco y cebada, sean muy solicitados en los mercados de la ciudad de Tarma. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus productos, lleva 41 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil cuidar de insectos así como del variado clima que afecta la producción. Con el tiempo, desea sembrar toda la extensión de terrenos que tiene, para que pueda aumentar su producción. Este es el noveno crédito con MFP, siempre ha sido muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas y espera serlo ahora también. En su grupo comunal es una socia muy solidaria con el resto de sus compañeras. Con los dos mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará semillas de arveja, ya que actualmente es lo que mejor se esta vendiendo.
texts.en:
Hermenegildo, 57, is a very responsible and hardworking man. He owns his home where he lives with his wife Matilde, 57, and their young son, who they love and who helps his father with the crops. Over the years, Hermenegildo has learned to be a very hard worker and strives to provide the highest quality crops in Tarma. As a result of his extensive effort, his crops, which include potatoes, peas, beans, root vegetables and barely, are in high demand in Tarma's markets. What he enjoys most about his work is harvesting. He has 41 years experience in this line of work and believes the most difficult aspects of it to be protecting the crops from insects and dealing with an unpredictable climate that can impact production. Over time, Hermenegildo wants to plant the entire area of land that he has, so he can increase production. This is his ninth loan with MFP. He has a solid history of making payments on time and plans to maintain that history with this loan as well. He is a very supportive member of his communal bank. He plans to use the requested $900 to buy pea seeds, given that peas are currently what is selling the most.

Translated from Spanish by Tyson Shelley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase pea seeds.

loans.name: Flor Mburucuya Group

texts.es:
El comité “Flor de Mburucuya” esta  recibiendo las capacitaciones del 4to. Ciclo del Programa Comité de Mujeres en la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso. Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes, como son las ventas de productos de uso domésticos, preparación de comidas rápidas y otros. Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su compañerismo.

Una de las integrantes es la señorita Besatbe quien se dedica a la venta de cosméticos. Esta actividad lo realiza visitando a mucha gente como a emplados de varias empresas, docentes de colegios y les ofrece sus productos a créditos ya que es la manera mas facil de vender, entre los productos mas vendidos estan los perfumes y maquillajes de buena marca. 

Ella es soltera y vive con sus padres, a quienes ayuda de cualquier forma ya que son una familia humilde ella integró el comité y solicito el crédito para la compra de cosméticos como perfumes, maquillajes, cremas que ella posteriormente vende a sus clientas de vaR. lugares.
texts.en:
The committee 'Flor de Mburucuya' is receiving training from the 4th cycle of the Programa Comité de Mujeres (Women's Committee Program) in the city of Mariano Roque Alonso. All the committee members are engaged in independent activities, such as sales, preparing fast food, and others. The members form a very united group and are very capable of realizing the activities that strengthen their comradeship. One of the members is señorita Besatbe, who works selling cosmetics. She visits many people, such as employees of various companies and schoolteachers, to offer them her products on credit (since that is the easiest way to sell. Her most popular items are brand name perfumes and makeup. She is single and lives with her parents, who she helps in whatever way she can. They are a very humble family. Besatbe joined the committee and requested a loan to purchase cosmetics such as perfumes, make-up, and lotions that she will later sell to her clients in various locations.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase make-up, perfumes and creams

loans.name: Jose Vicente

texts.es:
José de 30 años, vive en el Fortín de Guayaquil (perímetro periurbano con restos de una ecología en disolución). El tiene una tienda de vegetales y frutas en su casa.  

Con esfuerzo y dedicación el pudo construir una parte de su casa y convertirla en una pequeña tienda. Trabaja desde las 05h00am hasta las 23h00pm. Para tener mas oportunidad de incrementar su negocio el quiere comprar con el préstamo arroz, azúcar y aceite y así surtir mas su tienda. 

En el futuro quiere ser comerciante mayoristas de vegetales y frutas, también poder construir su casa mas grande.
texts.en:
José is 30 years old and lives in Fortín de Guayaqui (a periurban zone with the remains of a disintegrating ecosystem). He has a fruit and vegetable shop in his house. With hard work and dedication he was able to built his house and converted part of it into a small shop. He works from 5am til 11pm at night. To create better opportunities to grow his business he wants to buy rice, sugar and oil with this loan to stock his shop better. In the future José wants to be a wholesaler of fruit and vegetables, and build a bigger house.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar and oil

loans.name: María Anita

texts.es:
María Anita es una madre de familia de 42 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el distrito de Pacasmayo, un distrito bañado por aguas del océano Pacífico, pertenece a la provincia del mismo nombre y se encuentra ubicada en la región La Libertad, a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace mas de ocho años a la preparación y venta de bebidas en el mercado del distrito donde reside. Ella prepara soja, avena y chicha morada (bebida típica del país, hecha a base de maíz morado) en su vivienda y la ofrece en venta todos los días, sus principales clientes son todos los comerciantes de la zona y las personas que frecuentan este centro de abastos para comprar diversos productos.

Este negocio es una fuente importante de ayuda para la economía de su familia, por ello María Anita siempre se esfuerza por mantener su negocio de la mejor manera posible. Ella desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas insumos e implementos que le permitan ampliar la cobertura de su negocio. Por este motivo ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

María Anita es una mujer alegre y que dia a dia se esfuerza por salir adelante y sacar adelante a los suyos. Ella ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
María Anita, 42, lives with her husband and children in Pacasmayo district, a district that is bathed by the waters of the Pacific Ocean; it is a member of Pacasmayo province and is located in La Libertad region, two hours from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region’s capital. For over 8 years she has prepared and sold beverages in her district’s market. She prepares soja (soy bean), oatmeal and purple chicha (a typical drink of the country made from purple corn) at home and sells it daily. Her main customers are the various merchants in the area and people who frequent the foodstuffs wholesale market to buy various products. This business is an important source of income for her family so María Anita always puts in her best effort to run it in the best possible way. She hopes to expand her business buying more ingredients and tools that will help her grow. She is, therefore, asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 2000 new sol loan that will help her reach this objective. María Anita is a cheerful woman who daily makes the effort to succeed and raise her loved ones. She has collaborated with our Institution in the past and has always been punctual and responsible with her repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients and tools for beverage preparation and sales.

loans.name: Vilma De Jesús

texts.es: La Sra. Vilma B. es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, tiene cinco años de dedicarse al pequeño comercio donde ofrece ropa usada a sus clientes que en su mayoría son de las comarcas aledañas a dicho municipio. Tiene cuatro años de trabajar con Ceprodel donde le han otorgado cinco créditos para su negocio los cuales le han servido de mucho porque gracias a ello ha mantenido su negocio y diversificado de este tipo de producto. El crédito lo invirtió en la compra de pacas de ropa usada para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Vilma is originally from the town of El Sauce and has been running her small clothing sales business for five years. Most of her customers are from the surrounding area. She’s been working with Ceprodel for four years, where she had five previous loans. These loans have been very helpful and have allowed her to diversify and continue her business. She used the money from this loan to buy packs of second hand clothing to be able to satisfy her customer demand.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is a young man living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. At 29 years of age, he is married to a peasant wife and together they have four children aged 8, 6, 5, and 2 years.  He is the breadwinner for his family of six people. They live in a semi-permanent house Alex constructed with the income from his hard work. He dreams of one day constructing a permanent house. 

Alex operates a retail shop and has been in business for two years, now having begun selling Coca Cola only. He also has future plans of seeing his shop become a wholesale business for bigger opportunities. Alex intends to use the loan funds to purchase sugar, jelly, soap and other domestic items to sell in his shop.

loans.use: Purchasing sugar, jelly, soap for selling in his shop.

loans.name: Julián

texts.es: Julián, de 29 años, es un hombre muy sencillo y alegre, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Mery de 28 años y sus 2 queridos hijos y lo que más desea es sobresalir en la vida. La siembra de papa, choclo y arveja es la actividad a la que se dedica Julián, es así que todas las mañanas trabaja sus tierras para que sean más fértiles y productivas. Junto a su esposa trabajan muy duro, ya que saben que tiene que trabajar en todo lo que puedan, ya que la educación de sus hijos les demanda muchos gastos. Disfruta mucho el trabajo que realiza, entre ellas el cuidar sus cultivos de las plagas, ya que pueden perjudicarlo en la cosecha. Lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta el mercado de Tarma, que es donde vende sus productos. Dentro de unos días, espera cosechar y venderlos a buen precio en el mercado y así poco a poco juntar dinero, para poner una tienda de abarrotes dentro de su localidad. Este es el quinto crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, si no desea causarle problemas a su grupo comunal, en el cual es un compañero muy responsable y puntual. Con los ochocientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará nuevas semillas de arveja y papa, asimismo comprará abono para protegerlos.
texts.en:
Julián, 29, is a very easy-going, happy man. He owns his house, where he lives his wife, Mery, who is 28, and their two beloved children. His greatest desire is for his family to get ahead in life. Julián farms potatoes, corn and peas. Every morning, he works his land to make it more fertile and productive. He and his wife work very hard because they know they must work as much as possible in order to pay their children's education expenses. He enjoys his work very much. Between the two of them, Julián and Mery protect their crops from pests that can damage their harvest. He has been doing this type of work for 15 years and considers the most difficult aspect to be transporting his products to the market in Tarma, where they are sold. Within a few days, he hopes to harvest and sell his crops at the market for a good price, and in this manner to save money little by little. Eventually, he hopes to save enough to open a small grocery store in his community. This is Julián's fifth loan with MFP [Microfinanzas Prisma]. He knows that he must make all of his payments on time so that he won't cause any problems for his communal bank, where he is a very responsible and punctual group member. With the 800 nuevos soles he is requesting, he will buy new pea and potato seeds, as well as fertilizer to protect them.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy pea seeds, potato seeds, and fertilizer

loans.name: Celia Elizabeth

texts.es:
Celia tiene 20 años D. edad, es separada y tiene una hija D. año y medio D. nacida. Vive junto a sus padres en el distrito D. chepén, una zona agrícola D. alto movimiento comercial, pertenece a la provincia del mismo nombre y se encuentra ubicada en la región La Libertad, a una hora D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

La necesidad D. sacar adelante a su menor hijo y apoyar a sus padres en el sostenimiento del hogar hizo que empezara hace un año a trabajar vendiendo ropa por pedidos. Ella adquiere su mercadería en las ciudades D. Chiclayo y Trujillo para comercializarlos entre sus clientes. El negocio tiene buena acogida por la zona y ella nos comenta que cada vez viaja más frecuentemente para adquirir mercadería.

Celia desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo más prendas D. vestir D. la temporada para poder satisfacer la demanda D. sus clientes. Por ello se ha visto en la necesidad D. solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Celia es una mujer luchadora y que da lo mejor D. si para sacar adelante a su menor hija, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria hasta llegar a tener un establecimiento D. venta D. prendas D. vestir del cual se valga para progresar.
texts.en:
Celia, 20, is separated and has an 18-month-old daughter; she lives with her parents in Chepén district, an agricultural area with lots of commercial activity. It’s part of Chepén province and it’s located in La Libertad region, an hour away from the city of Chiclayo. The need to support her young child and to contribute to the support of her parents’ home led her to start selling clothing on order about a year ago. She gets her merchandise in Chiclayo and Trujillo to sell to her customers. Her business is well-received in the area and she tells us that she has to travel more and more frequently to acquire more merchandise. Celia wants to expand her business buying additional seasonal clothing to meet customer demand. She is, therefore, asking Edpyme Alternativa for her first, 2000 new sol, loan that will help her reach her objective. Celia is a tenacious woman who gives her best to support her young daughter. Her greatest wish is to continue to grow as a businesswoman until succeeding in having a store in which to sell clothing that will be her means to progress.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seasonal clothing.

loans.name: Mario Arturo

texts.es:
Mario de 41 años, vive en el Guasmo de Guayaquil (perímetro urbano, la mayoría de los habitantes son de clase baja). Empezó hace 4 años con el Cyber-cabinas, después que lo liquidaron en la empresa que trabajaba. 

Con esfuerzo y dedicación el pudo comprar computadoras y una cabina en el local. Desde ese tiempo hasta ahora el tiene su Cyber el cual es su primer ingreso económico para mantener a su familia, Trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 19h00pm todos los días. Con el préstamo quiere arreglar el local y comprar una computadora para su local.  

En el futuro quiere tener su casa propia, y tener un numero mas elevado de clientes.
texts.en:
Mario is 41 and lives in the Guasmo de Guayaquil (a built-up area where most of the residents are lower class). He began working with a computer cafe after the business where he worked was liquidated. With effort and dedication he was able to buy computers and a booth in a stand. From that time on he has had his Cyber business which is the main economic support for his family. He works from 7 am to 7 pm every day. With the loan he would like to fix up the stand and to buy a computer for it. In the future he wants his own house and to have a greater number of customers.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Computers and to set up his stand

loans.name: Lucinda

texts.es: Lucinda, de 38 años, es una madre muy amorosa y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Andres de 40 años y sus 3 hijos, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor educación. Trabajando arduamente, Lucinda ha logrado que sus chacras le brinden los productos necesarios, para mantener a su familia. Antes que el sol deje ver sus primeros rayos, sale de su casa y camina cerca de una hora y media para llegar a sus tierras, donde tiene sembrado papa, arveja, habas y olluco, productos que posteriormente lleva a vender hasta el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar sus tierras, ya que siente que les da un buen uso, lleva 30 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta Tarma, ya que los costales que lleva son muy pesados y la cansan mucho. Con el tiempo, desea poner una tienda de abarrotes, para que pueda mejorar su economía. Este es el noveno crédito con MFP, está muy feliz y quiere agradecer a todas las personas que harán posible que obtenga este aporte que necesita. En su grupo comunal es una socia muy respetada por el orden que pone en las reuniones. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará nuevas semillas de arveja, papa y olluco, asimismo comprará abono para aplicarlos a esta nueva siembra.
texts.en:
Lucinda, 38 years old, is a loving and hardworking mother. She lives in her own home with her husband Andres, who is 40 years old, and their 3 children, for whom they wish to provide a better education. By the sweat of her brow, Lucinda has been able to bring from her fields the necessary products to support her family. She leaves her house before dawn every morning and walks close to an hour and a half to arrive at her land, where she has sown potatoes, peas, beans and olluco (an Andean tuber). She will later bring these products to sell at the wholesale market in the city of Tarma. What Lucinda likes most about her work is cultivating her land, as she feels that she is putting it to good use. She has working the land for 30 years. Lucinda feels that the most difficult aspect of her work is transporting the produce to Tarma, because the sacks that she carries are very heavy, and she gets tired. With time, she would like to put in grocery store so that she can increase her income. This is her ninth loan with MFP; she is very happy and would like to thank all the people who have made it possible for her to obtain the support that she needs. She is a very respected member of her community group because of the order that she brings to their meetings. With the 1500 nuevos soles that she asks for, she will buy new pea, potato, and olluco seeds, as well as fertilizer to put on this new crop.

Translated from Spanish by Mairead Harris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of pea, potato, and olluco seeds, as well as fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: University Expenses (graduate fees)

loans.name: Las Azucenas Group

texts.es:
EL GRUPO SOLIDARIO SE LLAMA LAS AZUCENAS LA RAZON DEL NOMBRE ES POR QUE EN CASA  DE UNA DE LAS INTEGRANTES HAY ESAS FLORES. EL GRUPO  ESTA UBICADO EN LA LOCALIDAD DE JULIAN GRAJALES MUNICIPIO DE COPAINALA ESTADO DE CHIAPAS, MEXICO. CONOCIDO TAMBIEN COMO “SAN ANTONIO”. EL GRUPO ESTA CONFORMADO POR TRES SEÑORAS QUE SE CONOCEN DESDE HACE CUARENTA AÑOS.
LA SEÑORA FREDY ES REPRESENTANTE DEL GRUPO  LAS AZUCENAS, TIENE 40 AÑOS DE EDAD ESTUDIO HASTA EL TERCER GRADO DE SECUNDARIA. ESTA CASADA CON EL SEÑOR ROFINO FARELO SANCHEZ Y TINE EN TOTAL SIETE HIJOS LOS CUALES CINCO TIENE EN SU PODER: MAGDIEL DE 20 AÑOS, ESDRA DE 17, LIA ANILU DE 14 AÑOS Y CURSA EL TERCERO DE SECUNDARIA, DAVID, CON 12 AÑOS  EN SEXTO DE PRIMARIA, YEIDER DE 10 AÑOS. ELLA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE PANES DESDE HACE 20 AÑOS ANTERIORMENTE TRABAJABA CON SU MAMA LA SEÑORA RAQUEL V. G. QUIEN LA APOYABA PARA REALIZAR DICHA ACTIVIDAD, AHORA SOLO ELLA SE DEDICA A ÉSTA ACTIVIDAD.  SOLICITO EL PRETAMO PARA LA COMPRA DE INGREDIENTE COMO SON: HARINA, HUEVO, ACEITE, LEVADURA, ROYAL, CANELA, MARGARINA Y LECHE, Y ASI PODER CONTINUAR CON SU AVTIVIDAD, Y APOYAR A SU ESPOSO CON LOS GASTOS DE LA CASA, PARA QUE JUNTOS PUEDAN SACAR ADELANTE  A SUS HIJOS EN SUS ESTUDIOS PARA QUE CADA UNO TENGA MEJOR FUTURO DE VIDA.
 FREDY FORMO ESTE GRUPO CON SU MAMA LA SEÑORA RAQUEL V. GOMES QUIEN SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE ROPA COMO SON: PANTALONES, PLAYERAS, BLUSAS, CAMISAS ENTRE OTROS. ASÍ MISMO LA OTRA INTEGRANETE DEL GRUPO ES ROMETILDE HERNANDEZ H. EN LA VENTA DE ANTOJITOS COMO SON GORDITAS, TOSTADAS, EMPANADAS ENTRE OTROS.
texts.en:
This supportive group is called Las Azucenas (The Lillies). The reason for this name is because these flowers grow in one of the member's homes. The group is situated in the Julian Grajales locality, Copainala municipality in Chiapas state, Mexico. It's also known as 'San Antonio'. The group is made up of 3 ladies who have known each other for 40 years. Senora Fredy is Las Azucenas' representative. She is 40 years old, and studied until the third grade of secondary school. Fredy is married to Rofino Farelo Sanchez and in total they have 7 children, 5 of which are under their care: Magdiel (20), Esdra (17), Lia Anilu (14), David (21), who is in the third grade of secondary school, and Yeider (10) who is in the sixth grade of primary school. Fredy has worked selling bread for 20 years. Before this she worked with her mother, Raquel V. G., whom she supported doing the same activity. Now only Fredy makes bread. She is seeking a loan to purchase ingredients such as flour, eggs, oil, yeast, royal, cinnamon, margarine and milk, to continue her activities and to support her husband with the household costs, so together they can move forward and allow their children to study so each one has a better future in life. Fredy started this group with her mother, Raquel V. G., who works selling clothes such as pants, t-shirts, blouses and shirts, among others. The other member of the group is Rometilde Hernandez Hernandez who sells snacks such as gorditas, tostadas and empanadas, among others.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to make bread such as: flour, eggs, sugar, oil, royal, cinnamon and yeast

loans.name: Lizeth Katherine

texts.es:
Lizeth es una madre de familia de 27 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus dos hijos en una zona urbano – marginal del distrito de Castilla de la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, ubicada a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace tres años a la venta de prendas de vestir y artículos para el hogar en un pequeño establecimiento instalado en la vivienda donde reside. Sus principales clientes son las personas que viven por la zona, ella empezó vendiendo ropa por pedidos y poco a poco ha ido ampliando su negocio. Este negocio es una fuente importante de ingresos para su familia por lo que trata de sacarlo adelante de la menor manera posible.

Lizeth desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo mas mercadería para así poder ampliar sus ventas y percibir mayores ganancias. Por este motivo ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 700 nuevos soles que le ayuden a realizar su objetivo.

Lizeth es una mujer que da lo mejor de si para ver a su familia progresar, su mayor anhelo es llegar a tener una casa propia donde puedan radicar de una manera estable ya que actualmente viven en la vivienda de un familiar. En la zona sus vecinos y conocidos le consideran una mujer tranquila y responsable.
texts.en:
Lizeth is 27 and is the mother of a family. She lives together with her husband and her 2 children in an urban zone, marginal to the Castilla district in Piura, in the region of the same name, located 3 hours from the city of Chiclayo. For 3 years she has worked selling clothing zips and household articles in a small establishment located in the home where she lives. Her principle clients are the people that live in her zone. Lizeth began selling clothes by orders and little by little she has expanded her business. This business is an important source of income for her family, who she tries to move forward in the best way possible. Lizeth wants to expand her business by acquiring more merchandise to increase her sales and in turn receive better earnings. This is her motive for seeking a loan of 700 nuevos soles from Edpyme for the first time, as the loan will help her realise her objectives. Lizeth is a woman who likes nothing more than to see her family progress. Her biggest goal is to arrive at having her own home where she can live in a stable situation, as she and her family actually live in a relative's house at the moment. Amongst her neighbours and acquaintances in the zone she is known as a very calm and responsible woman.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: La Victoria  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal La Victoria esta conformado por un grupo de 8 socias que con el trabajo diario tratan de superarse poco a poco y entregarles a sus hijos un mejor futuro para que tengan una mejor vida, viven en la comunidad de la Victoria del Portete que es reconocida por sus llanuras ya que la mayor parte de su población se dedica a la ganadería y agricultura son personas luchadoras como nuestras socias. 

La Señora. Rosa T. es nuestra socia y va por su segundo crédito siendo invitada por una compañera de la banca comunal, se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos de otras casas, actividad que le realiza ya 10 años, trabaja de 7 a.m. hasta las 12 p.m., también se dedica a la cría de ganado levantándose muy temprano para entregar la leche e irse a trabajar, así ella obtiene dinero para comprar el pan diario de su familia, también ayuda a su esposo en los gastos de la casa. Ella  cría pollos  los cuales vende en su comunidad.

Nuestra socia tiene treinta años de edad, vive en unión libre y tiene tres hijos que estudian en una escuela de la comunidad, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, el es viudo y heredo la casa de su finada esposa en la que actualmente viven.  Su crédito lo va a invertir en comprar un caballo y así poder cuidar mejor a su ganado en el cerro, su meta es tener más ganado para así poder tener una fuente de ingresos más grande.

La Señora María Pérez tiene cincuenta años de edad, es viuda por veinte años y tiene dos hijos, el primer hijo tiene veinte y ocho años de edad,  trabaja y le ayuda económicamente a su madre, su otro hijo tiene  veinte y dos años de edad, el estudia en el SECAP (Servicio Ecuatoriano de Capacitación Profesional) y vive en su casita propia la cual ha construido.

Nuestra socia se dedica a realizar los quehaceres domésticos de una casa, actividad que la realiza hace 5 años de lunes a sábado, trabaja  de ocho de la mañana hasta las seis de la tarde, también se dedica a la cría de cuyes. Es socia del banquito hace ocho años y los créditos le han beneficiado para crecer en el negocio de  cuyes. Su nuevo  crédito lo va a invertir para comprar pollos ya que va a empezar con este negocio. Su meta es  agrandar su casa y también  tener agua potable para consumo de su hogar, se encuentran realizando mingas (Trabajo en grupo ) en la comunidad, están haciendo canales para llevar agua hasta sus hogares.
texts.en:
The La Victoria community bank is made up eight members who work hard each day to try to bring themselves up little by little; they all wish to give their children a better future and a better life. They live in the community La Victoria del Portete, which is known for its plains and fields, as the majority of the area’s population works in agriculture and animal husbandry. The residents of the area are strong people with a good work ethic, like the group’s members. Mrs. Rosa T., a member of La Victoria community bank, is going for her second loan, having been invited by another member. She has been doing domestic work in other people’s homes for 10 years, and she works from 7:00 a.m. to 12:00 p.m. She also raises chickens, which she sells in her community, and cows; she must get up very early to go milk her cows before going to work. With these jobs, she has earned enough income to provide her family their daily bread, and also to help her husband with household expenses. Rosa is 30 years old, and she lives with her common law husband and their three children, who are studying in a school in the community. Her husband works in agriculture; he is a widower and has inherited the house of his deceased wife, in which they currently live. Rosa will invest the loan in the purchase of a horse so that she will be able to better take care of her livestock up on the hill. Her goal is to have more livestock and be able to have a larger source of income. Mrs. María Pérez is 50 years old, and she has been a widow for 20 years. She has two children. Her eldest son is 28 years old; he works and helps his mother financially. Her other son is 22 years old, and he studies at SECAP (Servicio Ecuatoriano de Capacitación Profesional, a professional training school) and lives in his own house which he built. María does domestic work outside her home, a job which she has been doing for 5 years. She works Monday to Saturday, from eight in the morning until six in the evening, and she also raises guinea pigs. She has been a member of the community bank for eight years, and the bank’s loans have helped her to expand her guinea pig business. She will invest this new loan in the purchase of chickens, as she would like to begin a chicken business. Her goal is to put an addition on her house, and also to have drinkable water inside her home. The community is organizing group work teams (“mingas”) to make canals to bring water to people’s homes.

Translated from Spanish by Mairead Harris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of chickens and a horse

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es:
Gregorio de 64 años, vive en la Primavera de Duran (perímetro urbano fue originalmente irregular, con varios cerros, riachuelos y lagunas que aún se presentan como restos de una ecología en disolución). El tiene una tienda. 

Para poder solventar los gastos familiares el tuvo que invertir sus ahorros, decidió invertir sus ahorros y vender vivares, frutas y vegetales. Compro arroz, bebidas, frutas, vegetales. Poco a poco con esfuerzo a podido agrandar mas su negocio.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar enlatados, verduras y frutas para su tienda. En el futuro quiere surtir mas su negocio con nuevos productos.
texts.en:
Gregorio, 64 years old, lives in Primavera de Duran (in an urban perimeter that was originally a place with various hills, streams and lagoons which appear as the rest of the area as an ecological zone falling apart). He has a shop. To cover his family costs Gregorio had to invest his savings, and decided to sell supplies, fruit and vegetables. He purchased rice, drinks, fruits and vegetables. Little by little with hard work he has been able to expand his business. With this loan Gregorio wants to buy canned goods, vegetables and fruit for his shop. In the future he wants to stock his shop with more products.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fruit, canned goods, vegetables

loans.name: Macario

texts.es: Macario, de 45 años, es una hombre muy trabajador y responsable, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Teodora de 45 años y sus 2 menores hijos, a quienes desea brindar un mejor futuro. Los extensos campos de sembrado que posee Macario, son el fruto de una vida de arduo trabajo y de una firme convicción de sobresalir en la vida, sus productos son muy solicitados en el mercado mayorista de Tarma, ya que su fama de cosechar cultivos de calidad le ayuda a vender sus productos a muy buenos precios. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus sembríos de las plagas que perjudiquen su cosecha. Lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar los sacos de papa y arveja, ya que son muy pesados y le cansan mucho. En adelante, espera comprarse un carro, con el cual pueda hacer más fácil el traslado de sus productos. Este es el quinto crédito con MFP, sabe que este aporte le será muy beneficioso para el desarrollo de su trabajo. En su grupo comunal es un socio muy alegre y siempre pone orden en las reuniones. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará abono para sus sembríos, ya que desea que sus cultivos sean muy productivos.
texts.en:
Macario, 45 years old, is a hardworking and responsible man. He lives in his own house with his wife, Teodora, also 45 years old, and their two young children, to whom they would like to provide a better future. Macario’s extensive planting fields are the fruits of a life of arduous work and a firm resolve. His produce is in high demand at the wholesale market in Tarma, and his reputation of harvesting high quality produce has helped him sell at very good prices. The aspect of his work that he likes the most is protecting of his crops from the plagues that could damage his harvest. Macario has been doing agricultural work for 20 years, and he thinks that the most difficult part is transporting the bags of potatoes and peas to market, because they are very heavy and he gets tired from them. In the future, he hopes to buy himself a car, with which he would be able to move his produce much more easily. This is his fifth loan with MFP, and he knows that this support will be very beneficial to him as he develops his business further. He is a very upbeat member of his community group, always keeping order at the meetings. With the 1500 nuevos soles that he asks for, he will buy fertilizer for his fields, as he hopes that his crops will be more productive.

Translated from Spanish by Mairead Harris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer

loans.name: Nils

texts.es: Nils, de 29 años, es un padre de familia muy sencillo y alegre, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Reyda de 24 años y su único hijo, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. El trabajo al que se dedica Nils, es la siembra de papas, choclos y arvejas, los cuales después de cosecharlos, vende en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de tarma, en donde ya tiene varios clientes, que sabiendo de la calidad de su producto no dudan en esperarlo para comprarle todo al por mayor. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y hacerlas fértiles y productivas, lleva 5 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que cuidar sus siembra de la plaga o de otros insectos que perjudicasen su siembra. En adelante, espera seguir vendiendo sus productos, por lo tanto anhela comprarse un auto, con el que pueda transportar sus cultivos. Este es su noveno crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, si desea acceder a otro préstamo en el futuro. En su grupo comunal, es un socio muy responsable y preocupado por el bienestar de su grupo. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará fertilizantes e insumos para proteger su siembra de la plaga.
texts.en:
Nils is 29 years old, he is a very simple and happy family man, and he lives in a house he owns with his wife Reyda, who is 24 years old, and their son, the two reasons behind all of his efforts. Nils dedicates himself to agriculture, sowing potatoes, maize and peas: after the harvest he sells them on the wholesale market in the town of Tarma. He already has many customers there who, knowing the quality of his products, do not hesitate to wait for him to buy all his products in bulk. What he likes more about his job is sowing his lands and making them rich and productive. He has been working in this field for 5 years, and he thinks that the most difficult part is to protect his crops from the blight or from other insects that may harm his crops. He hopes to keep on selling his products in the future, and for this he wishes to buy a car to transport his crops with. This is his ninth loan with MFP: he knows he has to be punctual in his repayments if he wants to be granted another loan in the future. He is a very responsible member of his communal bank, always worried about the well-being of his group. With the two thousand PEN he is requesting he will buy fertilizer and supplies to protect his crops from the blight.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and supplies to protect his crops from the blight

loans.name: Carmen Cecilia

texts.en:
Carmen lives in Barranquilla with her husband and three children, who range in age from 16 to 28. She owns a small business called Karina's Fashions, which she started some 20 years ago so that the family would have a second source of income to sustain the household, improve the house, and most important, to educate their children. 

Carmen works every day making clothing, focusing on women's wear, although she knows how to do a bit of everything. She has previously received two loans from  Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and so comes into this Kiva loan with a good credit history and a reputation with our loan officers for running a well-organized business. 

She plans to use her Kiva loan to buy supplies, such as sheets of linen, Lycra, and t-shirt material. Her dream is to create her own line that could be easily identified in the market. She thanks God that she isn't currently facing any serious setbacks and instead can look forward knowing that she has a family she loves and a great capacity for hard work.

[EN ESPANOL]

Carmen Cecilia C., vive en Barranquilla con su cónyuge y sus 3 hijos en las edades de 16, 20 y 28 años; ella es propietaria del negocio “Modistería y modas Karina” negocio que emprendió en el año de 1.990 como una fuente de ingresos para ayudar a su esposo, al sostenimiento del hogar y especialmente en la educación de sus hijos y también a la adecuación de su vivienda. Carmen se dedica diariamente a confeccionar especialmente ropa femenina, aunque sabe hacer de todo un poco en el arte de confeccionar. Ella ha recibido 2 créditos de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo que le han proporcionado la posibilidad de crear historia crediticia y ser muy organizada en su negocio a través de la asesoría que recibe. En la actualidad es´tá aplicando a un crédito por valor de $ 1.600.000 COP para comprar materias primas e insumos especialmente telas de hilos, licras y franelas . Su sueño es crear su propia marca y que esta sea muy identificada en el mercado, ella da gracias a Dios porque no enfrenta ninguna dificultad en el momento y porque tiene el amor de la familia que siempre la acompaña y goza de una gran capacidad de trabajo.

loans.use: To buy supplies, such as sheets of linen, Lycra and t-shirt material

loans.name: María Jesús

texts.es:
María Jesús es una madre de familia de 38 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el distrito de Olmos, el distrito con la mayor extensión territorial de la región, se caracteriza por estar conformado por varios caseríos que distan mucho entre sí y por un pueblo central, sus principales actividades económicas son la agricultura y el comercio, pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicado a una hora y cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace más de dos años a la comercialización de verduras y de tubérculos en un puesto de venta ubicado en el mercado del distrito de Olmos, ella adquiere su mercadería en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Chiclayo y la ofrece todos los dias a sus clientes. Este negocio es una importante fuente de ingresos con las cuales ayuda a su esposo con los gastos familiares.

Su negocio goza de una buena acogida, por ello María desea ampliarlo con la compra de más verduras para ofrecerlas a sus clientes. Por este motivo ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles que le permitan lograr su objetivo.

María Jesús es una mujer tranquila y que goza de muca estima en la zona donde vive. Sus clientes prefieren su negocio porque ella siempre los recibe con un trato amable y una amplia sonrisa.
texts.en:
Maria Jesus is 38 years old, and lives with her husband and her children in the Olmos district, which is the largest in the region. It consists of several groups of houses separated from one another, and a central town. The main economic activities are agriculture and commerce. Olmos is in Lambayeque province, located one hour and forty-five minutes from Chiclayo. For more than two years, she has sold produce and tubers from a stall in the Olmos market. She gets her merchandise at the Chiclayo wholesale market and supplies her customers daily. This business is a major source of income for her to help her husband with household expenses. Her business is well received, and for this reason Maria would like to expand by buying more produce to offer her customers. For this reason she has made this first request to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 800 new soles, which will allow her to achieve her goal. Maria Jesus is a quiet woman who is held in high regard in her area. Her customers choose her because she welcomes them with a nice smile and friendly service.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tubers and produce to expand her sales in the market.

loans.name: Ovidio

texts.es: Ovidio, de 39 años, es un padre de familia muy alegre y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Reyda de 34 años y sus 5 queridos hijos, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. La actividad a la que Ovidio se dedica, es el cultivo de papa, choclo, olluco y arvejas, es así que todos los días, desde muy temprano por la mañana, trabaja sembrando estos productos, puesto que sabe que cuanto mayor sea la dedicación de sus cultivos mayor será la producción lo que significa una venta garantizada en el mercado mayorista de Tarma. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar, de esa manera recibe la recompensa de todo el esfuerzo que ha entregado sobre sus campos agrícolas. Lleva 32 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que cuidar su siembra de las plagas y otros insectos. Con el tiempo, desea comprar más tierras para ampliar su siembra. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, manifiesta que este aporte le ayudará mucho en el progreso de su trabajo. En su grupo comunal, es un socio muy responsable y respetuoso. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará semillas de papa y arveja, ya que en esta temporada son los productos que mayor demanda tiene.
texts.en:
Ovidio, 39, is a cheerful and hardworking father. He lives in his own home with his wife Reyda, 34, and their 5 beloved children who are the motivation for all of their efforts. Ovidio works in agriculture cultivating potatoes, maize, olluco (an Andean root vegetable) and peas. Each day, from early in the morning, he is working on his farm, since he knows that the greater his commitment the greater will be his crop production, which means a guaranteed sale on the wholesale market of Tarma. What he most likes about his work is the harvest, because this is when he sees the reward for all of his hard work in the fields. He has been doing this work for 32 years, and what he considers most difficult is having to protect his crops from diseases and pests. Over time, he wants to buy more land so that he can expand his cultivations. This is his first loan with MFP, and he states that this support will help him a lot to make progress in his work. In his communal bank he is a very responsible and respected member. With the 1,500 Peruvian soles he requests he will buy potato and pea seeds, since in this season these are the products in greatest demand.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy potato and pea seeds

loans.name: Dagoberto Enrique

texts.en:
Dagoberto is a strong man living in Barranquilla with his wife and three children, who range in age from 7 to 13. He has been able to get where he is in life by hard work and force of will. The couple runs a sports clothing store, where they sell shirts and hats branded by Colombian soccer teams, particularly the recently crowned national champions and local team Junior de Barranquilla. 

They have two sales stands side by side where they offer their merchandise: Dagoberto selling t-shirts and general sports wear, while his wife sells hats and also works hard to raise their children in a loving home. Dagoberto used to work selling handicrafts, and before that many other positions, but it's with this current enterprise that he has been able to generate the most stability for his family and find a solid place in the market. 

His main clients are passersby of Barranquilla's Metropolitan Stadium (the largest stadium in Colombia), the aficionados and sports fans most passionate in the city (and, consequently, most passionate in Colombia, as they tell it).

Dagoberto has requested this loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo (a Kiva partner) to update his inventory and add a sixth star to the Junior jerseys he sells to reflect their championship success in May of this year. Since receiving his previous loans (this is his fourth), he has been able to buy his house and improve it with furniture and other home necessities, as well as take care of his children. He and his wife hope their children grow into professionals; his biggest dream being that one or all of them becomes a doctor.

[EN ESPANOL]

Dagoberto B., es un hombre luchador que junto a su cónyuge han logrado salir adelante mediante el esfuerzo y el trabajo; ambos son comerciantes de ropa deportiva como camisetas y gorras de los equipos del futbol colombiano, especialmente la del Junior de Barranquilla. Tienen 2 puestos de ventas uno al lado del otro donde ofrecen su mercancía: por un lado Dagoberto trabaja vendiendo camisetas y en general ropa deportiva y por otro lado su esposa vende gorras y los dos trabajan mucho para ver crecer a sus 3 hijos en las edades de 7, 13 y 10 años con mucho bienestar y convertidos en profesionales. Dagoberto es un hombre que antes de ser comerciante es un artesano de naturaleza, pero ha tenido varios negocios y se ha quedado con el actual debido a que le ha generado mucha estabilidad y le va muy bien en el mercado. Sus principales clientes son los transeúntes de estadio Metropolitano de Barranquilla, los aficionados y fanáticos del deporte que mas apasiona en esta ciudad y en toda Colombia el Futbol. En la actualidad está solicitando su cuarto crédito a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para modernizar su inventario y agregar como insignia la sexta estrella del equipo Junior a todo lo que vende, así adicionará una estrella mas a las camisetas que tiene en stock y comprarán nuevo surtido con la sexta estrella que exigen sus clientes. Desde que recibió sus créditos Dagoberto ha logrado comprar y adecuar su vivienda, muebles y enseres necesarios para el hogar y sostener a sus niños en el colegió porque su máximo sueño es que alguno elija la medicina como su profesión.

loans.use: To update his inventory and add a sixth star to the jerseys he sells from the local pro-soccer team, reflecting their 6th Championship win

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy construction materials for his home and to help pay household expenses for a sick relative

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: La Señora Gloria Sánchez, es una persona muy emprendedora y perseverante, por tal motivo solicita este crédito ya que su negocio requiere de inversión en la compra de mataría prima para la elaboración de diversos platillo, y así aumentar la clientela que tiene desde hace tiempo y por lo tanto aumentar así sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Ms. Gloria Sánchez is a very hard-working and determined woman. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy core materials to prepare different dishes, in order to increase the number of the customers she has had for a long time and to improve her income.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy core products.

loans.name: Sandrita María

texts.es:
Sandrita es una madre de familia de 32 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el sector Palominos del distrito de Tambogrande, un distrito agrícola de la provincia de Piura, ubicado en la región del mismo nombre. Sus principales productos agrícolas son las frutas. La zona se encuentra ubicada a mas de tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de dos años a la venta de ropa interior para damas y caballeros. Ella cuenta con un stock de mercadería en su vivienda y también trabaja en base a pedidos, sus principales clientes son los vecinos de la zona y algunos allegados. Debido al tiempo que lleva trabajando en el rubro y a la calidad de las prendas que comercializa ha llegado a tener una clientela fija que siempre recurre a su negocio para solicitar su mercadería.

Sandrita desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más prendas para aumentar sus ventas y percibir mas ganancias que le permitan salir adelante. Por este motivo ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Sandrita es una mujer trabajadora y que ha sabido salir adelante junto a su esposo. Ellos se apoyan entre si y poco a poco están progresando. En la zona donde vive ella es muy estimada por las personas que la conocen.
texts.en:
Sandrita is a 32-year old family woman. She lives with her husband and their children in the Palominos sector of Tambogrande district, a farming district in Piura province, Piura region. Her main crops are fruits and her farm is located more than 3 hours outside Chiclayo city. Sandrita has worked for more than 2 years selling underwear for men and women. She stocks merchandise at her house and also takes requests. Most of her customers are neighbors in her zone and the neighboring zone. Due to how long she has worked in this trade, and to the quality of her merchandise, Sandrita has a good customer base that always turns to her business to shop. She hopes to expand her business by purchasing more merchandise and increasing sales, in order to make more profit and progress in her work. For this reason, Sandrita is requesting a 1,000 PEN loan for the first time from Edpyme Alternativa. This loan will help her reach her goal. Sandrita is a hardworking woman. She and her husband work hard to get ahead, little by little, while supporting each other. In the zone where they live, Sandrita is highly respected by everyone who knows her.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of men and women's underwear, and expansion of sales business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To make home improvements, adding brick and plastering the walls of his house

loans.name: Alcira Isabel

texts.en:
Alcira is a women who is particularly interesting because of her profound creativity and incredible capacity for work. She is a native of San Bernardo del Viento, near Cartagena, where her father worked in the fields and her mother tailored clothing for friends and relatives. Alcira learned the art of dressmaking watching her mother and even started out by making clothing for her dolls as a child. 

When she was 19 she got married and moved to Barranquilla, where her husband worked and where she would eventually have three children. Alcira began taking a course in tailoring to learn more and perfect her art. 

At 27, her husband abandoned her with her young children. Until then she had been working as an employee at a well-known clothier, but her salary  wasn't enough to cover rent, food and the cost of a babysitter for her children while she was at work. So after 16 years, she quit and used her cash on hand to begin her own business that she could run out of her home. 

She bought two simple, pedal-powered sewing machines and with her mother started to sew and sell her products to shops in malls around Barranquilla. Since then, she has stopped working, meanwhile raising her children to become professionals: an electro-mechanical engineer, an electro-mechanical technician and a doctor. She came to  Fundación Mario Santo Domingo at the recommendation of a friend. Since then she has received three loans, ranging in size from approximately $400 to $1,500, that have helped her buy equipment and grow her business to the point that she was able to hire three employees, all women heads-of-family. 

With this loan from Kiva, Alcira plans to buy supplies, including linen, zippers and accessories, to make into clothing for women, men, and children. Currently, her fixed assets include three electric sewing machines, two more advanced/industrial sewing machines for working with denim, a fabric cutter and a cutting table. 

Alcira is very grateful to her parents, her children and FMSD for giving her a hand in building her business. In the future, she hopes to continue becoming more and more successful so that she can employ more women heads-of-family so that they too can develop as she has.

[EN ESPANOL]

Alcira Isabel Ramírez D. es una mujer muy interesante por su gran creatividad y su gran capacidad de trabajo; oriunda de San Bernardo del Viento, en el departamento de Córdoba, lugar donde su padre realizaba labores del campo y su madre confeccionaba ropa a familiares y amigos, aprendió el arte de confeccionar viéndola a ella, e inició haciéndole ropa a las muñecas que tenía en su niñez. De 19 años se casó tuvo 3 hijos, como su esposo trabajaba en Barranquilla y los veía muy poco se vino a esta ciudad e inició un curso de confecciones para tener mas conocimiento y perfeccionarse su arte. Contando con 27 años y con sus hijos pequeños su esposo la abandonó. Así fue como empezó a trabajar de empleada en empresas de confecciones muy importantes, pero su remuneración no le alcanzaba para el alquiler de su vivienda, la alimentación y sueldo de la persona que cuidaba a los niños. Fue así como decidió renunciar después 16 años de trabajo y creó su propio negocio con su liquidación, Alcira inició comprando dos maquinas familiares y con la ayuda de su mamá empezaron a coser en la casa y vender en las colmenas de centro de Barranquilla, y de ahí no ha parado de coser, cuenta que esto le ha servido para el sustento y bienestar de sus hijos que ahora son profesionales de la Ingeniería electromecánica, Técnico electromecánico y Medicina. Conoció a la Fundación cuando una amiga le habló de esta organización y con sus créditos ha logrado adquirir maquinarias y crecer como empresaria generando empleo a otras mujeres cabezas de familia. Hasta la fecha ha obtenido 4 créditos desde $990.000 COP- hasta $3.000.000 COP y actualmente esta solicitando uno por valor de $2.000.000 COP para comprar materias primas como telas e insumos como hilos, correderas y accesorios para elaborar ropa para damas, caballeros y niños. Actualmente cuenta con 4 empleados, dos de llos son familiares y tambien con unos activos fijos entre los que se encuentran 3 máquinas planas, 2 máquinas de puntadas de seguridad, una cortadora, una familiar y una mesa de corte. Está muy agradecida con sus padres, sus hijos y la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo porque cuando necesitó de ellos le dieron la mano para salir adelante. En sus planes para el futuro está el de seguir siendo exitosa en su negocio para y darle empleos a muchas mujeres cabezas de familia principalmente para que progresen como ella.

loans.use: To buy supplies, including linen, zippers and accessories, to make into clothing for women, men and children

loans.name: Benita Gregoria

texts.es: Benita es de 65 años de edad, es casada, tiene tres hijos un varón y dos mujeres, se dedica a la comercialización de ropa para niño, en la actividad tiene aproximadamente 10 años de experiencia, solicita su segundo crédito para incrementar su capital en mercadería y surtir mejor su venta, el anterior crédito lo pago sin problema de atraso,
texts.en:
Benita is 65 years old, she is married and has three children, a boy and two girls. She sells children's clothes, and she has been working in this field for about 10 years. She is requesting a second loan to buy more products and to better furnish her shop. She repaid her previous loan with no delay.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy core products.

loans.name: Jesús Eduardo

texts.es: Jesús es de 30m años de edad, casado tiene un hijo varón, se dedica a la actividad de artesanía, elaboración de güipiles típicos, en la actividad tiene aproximadamente cinco años de experiencia, solicita su segundo préstamo para incrementar su capital de trabajo en compra de materiales, el anterior crédito lo pago sin problema de atraso, sus referencias personales indican que es una persona responsable y trabajador.
texts.en:
Jesús is 30 years old, he is married and has a son. He is a craftsman producing the traditional güipiles (woven ponchos), and he has been dedicating himself to this activity for about five years. He is requesting this second loan to increase his income and buy materials; he repaid the previous loan with no delay and he is know for being a responsible and hard-working man.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela U. is from the village of Nacional Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 48 and married with two school-aged children. To make a living, Adela runs a general store selling shampoo, soap, canned good and more. She has been engaged in her business for over 17 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Adela joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Adela from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Josefina Hortencia

texts.es: Josefina es de 30 años de edad, es casada, se dedica a prestar sus servicios como  maestra en un colegio en la localidad, la actividad lo realiza hace aproximadamente dos años, lo cual le ha ayudado para sacar adelante su familia, solicita su sexto crédito para sufragar gastos médicos ya que su salud es delicada, el préstamo anterior lo pago sin problema de atraso.
texts.en:
Josefina is 30 years old, she is married and she is a teacher in a school of her community. She has been working as a teacher for about two years, an activity that has helped her provide for her family. She is requesting her sixth loan to pay for medical expenses, as her health is very delicate. She repaid the previous loan with no delay.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Medical expenses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Improving her home and replacing the roof

loans.name: Angelica Soledad

texts.es: La Sra. Angelica tiene  50 años D. edad es casada su conyugue se encuentra laborando en una mina. La Sra. Angelica tiene 3 hijos ya mayores D. edad, ella vive en casa propia D. material D. adobe D. un piso ubicado en el Distrito D. Parcona. Ella se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes, verduras y frutas  en su casa, cuente con este negocio hace 10 años. La Sra. Angelica tiene un objetivo es poder contruir su casa D. material noble. Con el dinero que solicita sera para gastos D. su casa.
texts.en:
Angelica is 50 years old, she is married and her husband is a miner. She has three adult children, and she lives in the Parcona district, in a one-storey house that she owns maD. of adobe (sand and clay bricks). She has been selling groceries, vegetables and fruit in her house for 10 years. Angelica’s goal is to be able to build her house with nobler materials (such as wood or stone). The loan she is requesting will be used for her housing expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Personal housing expenses.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane E. is from the village of Magcamiguing Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 27 and married with one small child. To make a living, Jane owns a clothing business selling pants, miniskirts, and blouses. Jane has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Jane joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jane has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC which was used to to purchase additional inventory and working capital. She is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Jane from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Rosa Elvira

texts.es:
Rosa es una madre de familia de 37 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el distrito de Guadalupe de la provincia de Pacasmayo, ubicado en la región La Libertad, a una hora y diez minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace mas de cuatro años a la preparación y hamburguesas y sachipollo (plato de comida rápida originario del país, consiste en un plato de papas fritas y pollo frito). Ella ofrece su mercadería en un carrito ambulante y sale a ofrecer sus productos todos los dias por las noches en la plazuela de su distrito. El negocio goza de muy buena acogida debido a su buena sazón con la que prepara los platos que ofrece.

Esta actividad le permite a Rosa ayudar a su esposo con el mantenimiento de sus dos hijos, el trabaja como obrero en un molino de arroz cercano y ambos se esfuerzan diariamente para salir adelante. Rosa desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más insumos que le permitan preparar mas platos y aumentar sus ventas. Para lograr su objetivo ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Rosa es una mujer emprendedora y que da lo mejor de si para salir adelante. Anteriormente ya ha trabajado con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Rosa is a 37 year old mother who lives withe her husband and their children in the district of Guadalupe in the province of Pacasmayo, which is in the La Libertad region, an hour and ten minutes from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region. For more than four years she has been preparing food such as hamburgers and sachipollo (a typical fast food dish of the country which consists of fries and fried chicken). She sells her products from a mobile cart and does this every night of the week in the small square in her neighborhood. The business is very well received because of the good seasoning she uses to prepare the dishes she sells. This activity enables Rosa to help her husband with the expenses for looking after their two children. He is a worker in the nearby rice mill and they both strive daily to succeed. Rosa wants to grow her business by buying more supplies that will enable her to prepare more dishes and increase her sales. To achieve her objective, she has requested a loan of $725 from Edpyme Alternativa. Rosa is an enterprising woman who gives her best in order to succeed. She has worked with our institution before and has shown herself to be punctual and responsible in making her repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies to increase her production of hamburgers and salchipollo

loans.name: Pabla

texts.es: La Sra. Pabla M., tiene un negocio en el cual vende Ropa Usada, la señora requiere de este prestamos para comprar alambrado eléctrico debido a que hace poco le robaron todo el cableado de su negocio, ella tiene la necesidad de tener luz en su negocio porque pasa la mayor parte del día en el. Además desea reparar el techo de madera que esta muy deteriorado por las lluvias.
texts.en:
Pabla M. has a shop where she sells used clothes. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy an electric wiring system because all the wiring was recently stolen from her shop. She needs light in her shop because she spends most of her day there. She also wishes to repair the wooden roof, severely damaged by the rain.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy electrical wiring.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa L. is from the village of Naga, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 47 and married with two adult children. To make a living, Elsa owns  a business planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables including bananas, orange petchay, "calamongay," and "alogbati." Elsa is just starting this business and earns 7000 monthly.

In 2010, Elsa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elsa is requesting a loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Elsa from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.name: Sant Yalla Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe SANT YALLA vient juste d’être créé, les membres viennent de faire leur adhésion dans le Banc Villageois et ont reçu leurs premiers prêts, un prêt initial de 50.000 francs CFA pour chacune des membres. Le groupe est composé de 14 femmes toutes issues du même village. Elles ont constitué leur groupe par proximité et par affinité, elles sont âgées entre 25 et 50 ans et sont au moins mères de 2 enfants. L’activité principale du groupe est le petit commerce de produits divers tels la vente de produits halieutiques, d’effets vestimentaires, de produits cosmétiques et alimentaires et de crème glacée pour les détentrices de réfrigérateur. Le nouveau crédit permettra au groupe de solidarité de renforcer ses activités économiques et de les diversifier en achetant les produits dénombrés plus haut. Les membres du groupe, en sus des remboursements réguliers qu’elles font, participent beaucoup aux différentes charges financières de leurs familles respectives et mobilisent également de l’épargne au niveau de leur Banc Villageois. 

Madame Fatou BEYE, debout à droit de la photo en deuxième rang avec un foulard noir sur la tête est responsable du groupe de solidarité. Elle est âgée de 40 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants en charge dont 03 qui fréquentent l’école. Elle développe une activité commerciale et avec son nouveau prêt elle va acheter et vendre des parfums, des produits cosmétiques, de l’encens, des pagnes et des draps de lit. Elle pratique cette activité depuis 03 ans et n’y a pas encore rencontré de problème. Son mari est en voyage et ne vient qu’une seule fois par an pour voir la famille, cette situation fait qu’elle assure une bonne partie de la prise en charge familiale. Par exemple : la nourriture, la santé et la scolarité des enfants. Et cela ne lui empêche pas de faire des remboursements réguliers et d’augmenter chaque fois son niveau d’épargne.
texts.en:
The group SANT YALLA has just been created.  The members are here to join the Banc Villageois and have received their first loans, an initial loan of 50,000 francs CFA for each member.  The group is composed of fourteen women, all from the same village.  They formed their group by proximity and affinity.  They range from 25 to 50 years of age, and they are mothers of at least two children each.  The main work of the group is small-scale commerce in various goods, such as seafood products, clothing and accessories, cosmetics, foodstuff, and ice cream for those members having a refrigerator.  The new loan will enable the solidarity group to bolster its businesses and to diversify them by purchasing the goods mentioned above. The group members, in addition to regular payments they make, take part in covering the various expenses of their respective families. And they also raise money to save at their Banc Villageois. Ms. Fatou BEYE (who is standing at the right in the photo in the second row and wearing a black scarf on her head) is the head of the solidarity group.  She is 40 years old, married, and the mother of six children to support.  Three of the children attend school.  Fatou is developing a business. And with her new loan, she is going to buy and sell perfumes, cosmetics, incense, pagnes (colorful West African cloth), and bed sheets.  She has been in this business for three years and has not encountered any problems yet.  Fatou's husband is on travel and comes to see the family only once a year. As a result of this situation, Fatou makes sure the bulk of family expenses are covered, for example: food, health care, and schooling for the children.  This does not keep her from making regular loan payments or from increasing her savings each time.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering and developing the businesses of the solidarity group

loans.name: Lucio

texts.en:
Lucio B. F. is a 51-year-old pepper producer and father of nine who lives in the region of Coquital de Los Chiles de San Carlos, located in Northern Costa Rica. Lucio is a dedicated producer and father. He plans to focus his efforts on the planting and harvest of Tabasco peppers. He works in cooperation with his wife to strike a balance between accomplishing the daily tasks associated with agricultural production and the completion of domestic responsibilities. The land they work is their own. 

In addition to his agricultural activity, Lucio works at a local Orange producing factory as a harvesting labourer in order to supplement family income. The money he earns helps pay bills for electricity and to buy food. The rural zone where Lucio and his family live is one of the few places in Costa Rica without running water; the family must pump water from a nearby well as needed. Lucio is working hard towards the sustenance of his family, striving to reap the maximum benefits from his land and his labour. 

Although this is an individual loan, the community in which Lucio and his family live is very close-knit and interdependent. Neighbours help and support one another by sharing experiences and expertise acquired over the years. All individual members of the Coquital community are dedicated to the improvement of living conditions for the region as a whole.

This loan will be used to finance the production of Tabasco peppers. Specifically, the loan will be used to finance the purchase of a variety of seedlings and necessary agricultural nutrients, fertilizers and chemicals in order to ensure a healthy harvest. All labourial and logistical tasks associated with production will be carried out by Lucio with the help of his family members in the region of Coquital de Los Chiles, located in the Northern Region of Costa Rica. Lucio will need roughly one year before his peppers will reach maturity and be ready for harvest. 

Piper and Capiscum Processors Compañía Agrícola Industrial, or, PROPICA is an international buyer and seller of chili pepper and ground pepper products. In cooperation with Fundación Mujer, PROPICA has guaranteed to purchase the agricultural products (the peppers) that are to be produced with the help of this loan. PROPICA acts as a guaranteed client for small agricultural producers in the area of Coquital, thus ensuring that their products will reach market. 

In general, the work day is divided into mornings and afternoons. In the morning, the domestic tasks are carried out such as cooking, cleaning and sending the children to school. Afternoons are generally dedicated to harvest and planting, working the land as needed. Lucio spends some days working as a labourer in the nearby Orange producing factory, but this work is sporadic. Lucio says that he has had difficulty obtaining access to both financial services and technical assistance with respect to farming. This has made it difficult for him and his family to reap the benefits of maximizing their potential productive output on their land. 

The collaboration of Fundación Mujer and PROPICA, represents a unique opportunity to Lucio, his family and community. By offering a source of start-up capital, and a guaranteed client to purchase what is produced, this is a chance to improve family and community standards of living. Above all, Lucio wants to take advantage of the current opportunity that has been presented, he wants to profit from this collaboration and see improvements in his neighbourhood.

loans.use: For the purchase of seeds and nutrients necessary for the production of peppers
