loans.name: Natalya

texts.en:
Natalya is married, with one son. She works as a secretary at a government office. In addition to that Natalya and her husband grow vegetables for sale during summer. Natalya is open and honest and has a good reputation with her neighbors.

Natalya would like to receive a loan of 6,500 UAH to improve her living conditions. She would like to fix her summer kitchen — a place where she does her cooking and canning during summer — to make it cleaner and more nice-looking.

loans.use: To improve her living conditions.

loans.name: Srey's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of four people who live in Ta Preah village in Takeo province. Mrs. Srey S. is the group leader as selected by the other members who will each use their portion of the loan for different purposes. 

Mrs. Srey S. was born in 1974. She is a farmer who owns a three-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support her family. At present, she has some problems because her field is infertile and it needs to be plowed. In order to improve production, Mrs. Srey S. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer, rent a machine to plow her field, and, with the remainder of the loan, she plans to buy some piglets for breeding to start a new business. Her husband, Mr. Sam Art Den, is a duck breeder. She is the mother of three children who all attend the local public school. The day of the loan disbursement, Mrs. Srey S. was busy working in the field. Therefore, her husband, Mr. Sam Art Den, received the loan for her. The photo above is of Mrs. Srey S.'s husband.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rent a plow.

loans.name: Almonem Group

texts.en: Abid Mier is the leader of the Almonam group. He lives in district 2-of Jalalabad City. He is 41-years old and married with five children. He has an aluminum utensil shop. Currently, his business income is insufficient to meet his family needs. Therefore, he would like a loan to purchase essential aluminum utensils which are in demand in the city in order to enlarge his business capacity and meet his family needs. He would like to thank all Kiva lenders for their effective loan process in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To purchase inventory.

loans.name: Suhrobjon

texts.ru: Ашуров Сухробчон проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Возраст, 27 лет. Женат, имеет 2 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Сухробчон имеет среднее образование. Подрабатывает строительными работами по найму. Кроме того более 10 лет занимается животноводством. Разводит скот у себя дома. Кредит берет для закупа дойной коровы.
texts.en:
Suhrobjon A. lives in the town of Tursun-zoda. He is twenty-seven years old, married with 2 children. His wife is a homemaker and he has a secondary education. He also works part-time in construction. He has raised livestock for over 10 years. He is asking for a loan to purchase a milk cow.

Translated from Russian by Susan Savkov, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase milk cow

loans.name: Simon's Group

texts.en:
Six members of a group loan live in Prey Chheu Teal village in Takeo province. Mrs. Simon M. is the group leader as selected by the other members who will each use their portion of the loan for different purposes. 

Mrs. Simon M. is 29 years-old. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land where she cultivates rice to sell to support her family. She also sells chickens  at her local market. Since her business is going well she plans to expand.  In order to improve her business, Mrs. Simon M. is applying for a loan to buy more chickens to resell. Her husband, Mr. Sophorl Phoeurn, is a motorbike taxi driver. She is the mother of three children who all attend local public school.

All the members of the group are in this photo, but the face of one is blocked by another member.

loans.use: To buy more chickens to resell.

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is married and has a 10-year-old son. She runs a retail business selling cosmetics. Her business is located in a department store where Irina rents space. She has been in this business for 10 years. 

Irina is honest, disciplined and entrepreneurial person. Lots of repeated customers and low competition help Irina make this business a success. 

Irina would like to borrow 8,000 UAH to increase the assortment of her inventory. She hopes to receive additional income and develop her business further.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of cosmetics for sale

loans.name: Tojiddin

texts.ru: Умаров Точиддин проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Возраст, 31 год. Женат, имеет 2 детей. Образование среднее. Более 5 лет занимается животноводством. Разводит скот у себя дома. У него имеется две дойной коровы. Точиддин в основном продает молоко. Кредит берет для закупа дойной коровы.
texts.en:
Tojiddin U. lives in the town of Tursun-zoda. He is 31 years old; married with two children. He has a secondary education. For over five years he has been in livestock husbandry. He breeds livestock at home. He has two dairy cows. Tojiddin mostly sells milk. He is requesting the credit to purchase a dairy cow.

Translated from Russian by Anna Melyakova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Galina

texts.en:
Galina is married and has no children. She sells women's and children's clothing at a local open market in Kherson town. Galina has been in this business for 10 years. She is a hard-working and disciplined person. These character traits, as well as a good location, have helped Galina develop her business. She enjoys selling clothing and would like to develop her business further.

Galina is requesting a loan of 7,300 UAH to purchase more inventory. She hopes to earn additional income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Tuymurod

texts.ru: Хайдаров Туймурод проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Возраст, 31 год. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Туймурод имеет средне - специальное образование, электрик. Работает по профессии. Кроме того занимается торговлей. Возле своего дома открыл магазин, где продает продукты питания. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже 2 года. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en:
Tuymurod H. lives in Tursunzade. He is 31, married, and has 3 children. Tuymurod's wife is a homemaker. Tuymurod is a professional electrician. In addition, Tuymurod opened a small food store near his house. Tuymurod has been selling food for more than 2 years. He will use this loan to purchase additional inventory.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory for a food store

loans.name: Odiljon

texts.ru: Боев Одилчон проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Возраст, 32 года. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Образование средне - специальное, электрик. Работает по профессии. Кроме того занимается производством муки. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже 5 лет. Целью кредита является закуп сырья, т.е. пшеницы.
texts.en:
Odiljon B. lives in Tursunzade. He is 32, married, and has 3 children. Odiljon is a professional electrician. In addition he has a mill. Odiljon has been grinding flour for 5 years. He will use this loan to purchase wheat for his mill.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wheat

loans.name: Saturnino

texts.en:
52-year-old Saturnino D. is from the town of Guitas. He is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Saturnino owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Saturnino has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Saturnino joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Saturnino has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Saturnino is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Saturnino from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay his children's school fees and improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, the organization has numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients, but also savings, insurance, and training, which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our field partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.en:
Wilfredo S. is from the town of Guitas. He is 59 years old and married, and he has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Wilfredo owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Wilfredo has been engaged in his business for over 15 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Wilfredo joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Wilfredo has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Wilfredo is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds and fertilizers. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Wilfredo from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family and to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Adolat

texts.ru: Холбобаева Адолат проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Возраст, 50 лет. Замужем, имеет 6 детей. Муж, работает в заводе, где производят фарфор. Сама Адолат более 16 лет занимается торговлей на рынке. Она продает муку. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en:
Adolat K. lives in Tursun-zoda. She is 50 years old. Married with six children. Her husband works at a china factory. Adolat has been a vendor at the local market for over 16 years. She sells flour. She is taking out a loan in order to increase her sales volume.

Translated from Russian by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing her sales volume

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is a farmer in western Kenya. He has been farming for 9 years.  He employs one farm hand on his mixed farm, where he produces milk from his dairy cows.  Geoffrey also draws some income from a retail shop he owns.

This will be his third loan from Juhudi, but both of his previous loans were smaller.  In 5 years, Geoffrey hopes to open a store to sell seeds.  He cites a lack of piped water as a significant business challenge.

Geoffrey is 28, and has three kids who are between 9 months and 3 years of age. He says this loan will allow him to provide for his family's basic needs, as well as to pay for his kids' school fees.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a farmer in western Kenya, and aside from his dairy business, he also produces tea.  He's been in business for 18 years, and employs one other person on his farm.  

Joseph is 53, married, and has 6 children between 5 and 22; all of them are in school.  

Joseph dreams of building a modern dairy unit and improving the breed of his cows to larger and more productive ones in the future.  His challenges include a lack of sufficient funds to meet the demands of a high-quality dairy cow, and poor infrastructure that make it difficult to transport milk to the market.

Joseph believes that with this additional dairy cow, he'll be able to borrow a larger loan next year, which will help him expand his businesses.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Dervina

texts.en:
Dervina P. is from the village of  Digkilaan , Iligan City. She is 37 years old. Dervina is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Dervina owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Dervina has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Dervina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dervina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Dervina is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Dervina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a farmer in western Kenya.  He's 27 and has been running his dairy farm for 6 years.  He employs one farm hand on his farm.  Paul sells his milk to the local market.  He also sells tea leaves, which he grows on his farm.

In the future, Paul hopes to improve his dairy-farming business by acquiring better breeds and more land from which to harvest feed.

When asked about business challenges, Paul cited a lack of knowledge about animal feed and diseases, as well as poor marketing and transportation networks to the market.  

Paul is single, and he hopes to apply for additional loans in the future.  He requests continued support from Juhudi and Kiva!

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn P., photographed with her 4-year-old son, is from the town of Trento. She is 24 years old and married. She is involved in farming. She has been planting and harvesting rice crops for more than two years now. She sells her harvest at the market. Her husband helps at the farm and also earns money from his motorcycle transportation business. 

Arlyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arlyn has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Arlyn is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Arlyn from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, the organization has numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients, but also savings, insurance, and training, which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Mambo from Kenya!

Anthony is a dairy and tea farmer living in western Kenya.  He's 31, and has been farming for 4 years.  He sells his milk at the market, and his tea leaves to the local factory.  In the future, he hopes to purchase higher quality dairy cows and increase his production of milk to 50 liters per day.  He also hopes to build a high quality structure to house his dairy cows.  

He cites a few business challenges: the lack of good roads to the market, and poor prices that fluctuate often.  

Anthony has 3 children between 7 and 24.  He says this loan will help him pay for family needs.  He thanks Juhudi for providing access to this loan, and assures us he will repay well so as to have access to additional loans in the future.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Alosius

texts.en:
Hardworking M. Alosius contemplated a means of surviving the hard-poverty life in his home area and started up a machine welding business on Jubilee Street, Ibanda town.

Due to good customer care and efficient service delivery, Alosius has been able to maintain his business for seven years as he gets customers throughout the year. His main challenge is that he does not have enough capital to purchase the welding materials he normally uses to make house windows, doors, beds for boarding schools, chairs for resorts and many other products.

Therefore Alosius is seeking a loan to help him purchase the raw materials for his business which include iron bars, rolls of steel and more. This will help him improve his output and thus earn more sales revenue that will enable him to take care of his siblings and live a sustaining life.

loans.use: To purchase more welding materials like iron bars, rolls of steel and so on

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Mambo from Kenya!

Charles has requested this 45,000 KSH loan to purchase an insured dairy cow.  He is a dairy farmer who has been in this business for 4 years and employs one farmhand on his farm.  In addition to selling milk from his dairy cows, he also sells tea leaves to the local tea factory.

He dreams of someday owning three high-quality cows, and of increasing the amount of land he has for planting feed.  He would also like to start a breeding farm for "heifer" cows.

Currently, Charles says he is challenged by the lack of sufficient land for his cows to graze on, and poor roads to the market.  

Charles is 25 and has a child who is one year old.  He says that with this loan he will be able to increase his milk production to a sustainable level.  He also hopes to receive a training course on dairy farming soon.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Mamerto

texts.en:
Mamerto F. is from the town of Trento. He is 57 years old. Mamerto is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Mamerto owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Mamerto has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

Mamerto joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mamerto has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Mamerto is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the third loan taken out by Mamerto from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Mehriniso

texts.ru: Тошева Мехринисо проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Возраст, 44 года. Замужем, имеет 4 детей. Образование среднее. Занимается торговлей. У нее магазин, где она продает муку оптом. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже 15 лет. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en:
T. Mehriniso lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. She's forty-four years old, married and has four children. She has a high school education and makes a living by selling large quantities of flour in her store. She has been in business for fifteen years, and is asking for a loan to increase her goods turnover.

Translated from Russian by Alex Kostrubsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase goods turnover

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa D. is from the village of  Digkilaan, Iligan City. She is 40 years old. Elsa is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Elsa owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling bananas in the local community. Elsa has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Elsa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elsa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Elsa is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Elsa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Vermina

texts.en:
Vermina Y. is from the village of Lugait,  Misamis oriental. She is 31 years old. Vermina is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Vermina owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Vermina has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Vermina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vermina is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Vermina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida P., 50 years old, is from the town of Trento. She is married and has 3 children. To make a living, Nida owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Nida has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities. She hopes for her business to prosper.

Nida joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nida has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Nida is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure and other farm inputs. This will be the third loan taken out by Nida from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure and other farm inputs

loans.name: Evella

texts.en:
Evella R. is from the village of Mainit, Iligan City. She is 50 years old. Evella is married and has 11 adult children. To make a living, Evella owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling bananas in the local community. Evella has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Evella joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evella is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Evella from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Sharifjon

texts.ru: Латипов Шарафчон проживает в городе Душанбе. Возраст, 25 лет. Женат, детей не имеет. Более 5 лет занимается торговлей. Он в основном продает арбуз и дыню. Его бизнес является сезонным. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en:
L. Sharifjon lives in Dushanbe City. He's twenty-five years old, married and has no children. For more than five years he has been in the seasonal business of selling melons and watermelons. He's requesting a loan to increase his goods turnover.

Translated from Russian by Alex Kostrubsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase goods turnover

loans.name: Annaliza

texts.en:
Annaliza D. is from the village of  Digkilaan, Iligan City. She is 32 years old. Annaliza is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Annaliza owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Annaliza has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Annaliza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Annaliza is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Annaliza from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Nga-Xom Vang Group

texts.en:
Nga T. N. is 37 years-old. She lives in Vang village, Co Loa commune. She is married with [6 years old]. The [first] child has a job and income. The other children are going to school. Mrs Nga has a store which sells dry goods. She has has this job for many years. She has a monthly income of about 3,000,000 Vietnamdong (VND). She needs a loan to invest in her store. She has participated with Kiva partner SEDA since 2007. Last cycle she borrowed 4,142,000 VND and repaid punctually. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 6,322,000 VND in order to expand her store. She is the leader of a six-member group loan from SEDA.

 About the other borrowers in her group.

 Du T. N. is 52 years-old and she would like to borrow 6,758,000 VND to breed poultry.
 Tuan T. N. is 48 years-old and she would like to borrow 5,014,000 VND for her small business.
 Lan V. H. is 48 years-old and he would like to borrow 6,322,000 VND to buy goods to sell.
 Hien T. D. is 34 years-old and she would like to borrow 5,014,000 VND for her business.
 Gai T. N. is 48 years-old and she would like to borrow 5,014,000 VND to expand her store.

loans.use: In order to expand her store.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda D. is from the town of Trento. She is 44 years old, married and has 6 school-aged children. She raises pigs for fattening and sale. She also runs a sari-sari store where she sells basic food and daily products. She says she works hard to provide for her family, especially for her children's education.

Erlinda joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. She is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. This will be the third loan taken out by Erlinda from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business and pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en:
Gilda I. is from Iligan City. She is 45 years old, widowed and has 3 adult-aged children. Gilda owns and operates a business making and selling food, primarily snacks and other delicacies, in the local community. Gilda has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2009, Gilda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gilda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Gilda is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be again be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Gilda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia B. is from the town of Trento. She is 42 years old, married and has 4 school-aged children. Virginia owns and operates a farming business, primarily planting and harvesting rice for sale. Virginia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from it.

Virginia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virginia has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Virginia is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. This will be the third loan taken out by Virginia from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over recent years. Based in Bohol, it has numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Saidoy

texts.ru: Гафурова Саидой проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Возраст, 42 года. Замужем, имеет 4 детей. Муж и сын работают на заводе. Сама Саидой более 7 лет занимается животноводством. Она откармливает и продает скот. Кредит берет для закупа крупно - рогатого скота.
texts.en:
Saidoy G. lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. She's forty-two years old, married and has four children. Her husband and son work in a factory. For over seven years Saidoy has raised cattle. She fattens it and then sells it on the market. She's requesting a loan to buy some large livestock.

Translated from Russian by Alex Kostrubsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy large livestock

loans.name: Carine

texts.en:
From the town of Sta. Josefa, Carine M. is 26 years old, married, and has a six-year-old child. To make a living, Carine has been planting and harvesting rice for sale for over nine years now.

Carine joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan from CEVI, she is now requesting a new loan, her fifth, of 13000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. Carine plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Khemhong's Group

texts.en:
In Aopheasang village in Takeo Province, Mrs. Khemhong M. is the leader of a group loan whose four members will each use their portion of the funds to improve their businesses in the future.

Khemhong, 52 years old, is a frog and palm seller at her local market, where she earns some money to support her family. Since business is going well, she wants to expand and so is requesting a loan to buy more frogs and palms to resell. Khemhong is a widow with four children, three of whom are attending local public school, while the other is a seamstress in a garment factory.

loans.use: To buy more frogs and palms to resell

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
34-year-old Juvy D. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She has been married to her husband Tirso for ten years and they now have six school-aged children. Both of them want their kids to be given a proper education, that's why they both work hard to achieve their goal. Juvy is involved in farming and has been planting and harvesting rice crops for sale for over five years now. She says that despite the difficulties she experienced with her business, she still continues to work hard for her family.

Juvy joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juvy has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Juvy is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm inputs like seeds and fertilizers. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Juvy from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs like seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a farmer in eastern Kenya.  She's been running her mixed farm for 4 years and employs one farm-hand.  Her farming produces kale, bananas, and potatoes, which she sells on the local market.

With this loan (her second from Juhudi Kilimo), she'll buy an insured dairy cow.  In 5 years, Mercy plans to construct rental houses on her plot of land.  The location is good since it's close to the market and the demand is high.  She hopes this will boost her income.

The primary business challenges Mercy cites are pests and crop diseases, as well as high feed prices for livestock.

Mercy is married, 35 years old, and has 2 children (one 10, and the other 2 and a half months).  Her ten-year-old attends school.  She hopes this loan will improve her family's living standard and she will use the revenue from her farming towards her children's schooling.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is a farmer from Kisii town in Western Kenya. She is 36 years old and married with 9 children. All her children are attending school. 

She has been farming for 20 years, producing sorghum, millet, beans, coffee, bananas, maize and tea which she sells locally and to Kenya Tea Development Authority. She also operates a posho (cornmeal) mill in the same area. She is pictured above in her posho mill. Her biggest challenge in farming has been crop diseases which affects her output.

She recently completed her second loan from Juhudi Kilimo and has requested this loan of 90,000 KES to expand her farming business by planting more sorghum, millet and beans and to purchase a dairy cow. She says that with this loan, her income base will increase hence enabling her to educate and feed her children.

She would like to purchase another posho mill in future. She is grateful to Juhudi for the loans which have enabled her to establish her business.

loans.use: To expand her farming business and purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
30-year-old Merly P. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Merly owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Merly has been engaged in her business for over 9 years now. She hopes to have a stable income so she can sustain her children's education.

Merly joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merly has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Merly is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure and other farm inputs. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Merly from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure and other farm inputs

loans.name: Rolly

texts.en:
Rolly T. is from Iligan City. He is 31 years old. Rolly is married and has 5 children. To make a living, Rolly owns & operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing motorcycle  services to local community members. Rolly has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rolly joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rolly is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Rolly from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Lolango Plus Group

texts.en:
Lolango Plus is a group of 19 owners of small businesses chaired by Lina. Its members are collectively responsible for loans granted by Kiva to grow their businesses.

Lina is determined to be a successful businesswoman as she operates her own restaurant in her area southwest of Kinshasa. Since 2006 she has acquired solid experience, working hard and developing good management skills in order to realize her dream of one day opening a big restaurant. She would also like to achieve financial independence through her business, which currently earns her $280 per month. Lina works to the best of her abilities and uses her contacts so that she might achieve her goals. A trustworthy client of the MFI HOPE RDC, having five times obtained and repaid loans, she will increase her stock of merchandise with her next loan by buying fish with the aim of making additional profit.

Thirty-eight years old, Lina is married and the mother of four children ranging in age between 9 and 20 years old.

loans.use: To increase her restaurant inventory with the aim of making additional profit

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Thy's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of 16 people residing in Rovieng village in Takeo Province. All of the members will use their portion of the funds to improve their businesses in the future.

Mr. Thy E., the village bank president selected by the other members, is a farmer who owns a 1.5 hectare plot of land upon which he cultivates rice to sell to support his family. He is also a white wine maker. Since business is going well, Thy wants to expand and so is seeking a loan to buy more rice to make white wine. His wife, Mrs. Yx Ngen, is a pig breeder at her home.

Thy is a father of six children, one of whom is a seamstress in a garment factory, while four are enrolled in local public school, and the youngest is just three years old.

loans.use: To buy more rice to make white wine

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena P. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 49 years old, married to Felix and has 3 school-aged children. Nena owns and operates a farming business, primarily planting and harvesting rice for sale. Nena has been engaged in her business for over 20 years. Like other mothers, she says she works hard for her children's education so they could have a bright future.

In 2008, Nena joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nena has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. She is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which will be used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment for land preparation. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Nena from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies and equipment for land preparation

loans.name: Rey

texts.en:
Rey M. is from the village of  Mainit, Iligan City. He is 21 years old and married. Rey owns and operates a business providing motorcycle services to local community members. Rey has been engaged in his business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Rey joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rey is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This will be the first loan taken out by Rey from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Koem

texts.en:
Mrs. Koem S. is living in Smaong village in Takeo province and she was born in 1959. She is a duck breeder who can earn some money from selling duck eggs to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Sun Soun, is a farmer who owns one hectare of land to cultivate rice to sell to support his family. 

Her problem is that she does not have enough duck feed for her ducks. So to improve her duck-breeding business, Mrs. Koem S. is applying for a loan to buy duck feed. With the rest of the loan she will cover farming expenses such as fertilizer, and rent a plow to plow her husband’s field. She is a mother of three children, one of whom is helping her to breed ducks, while the others are attending local public school.

loans.use: to buy duck feed, fertilizer, and rent a plow

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Mrs. Ly Y. is a villager in Spueu village in Takeo province and she was born in 1974. She is a farmer who owns a half-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice on to sell to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Mom Srey, is a construction worker who can also earn some money to support his family. They try to work a lot but they can only earn a little income. 

So to improve her family's living conditions, Mrs. Ly Y. is asking for a loan to buy some piglets and pig feed for breeding pigs to start a new business. She is a mother of three children, one of whom is attending local public school, while the others are too small to work or study.

loans.use: To buy some piglets and pig feed for breeding pig

loans.name: Sheryl

texts.en:
Sheryl D. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 25 years old, married and has a 4-year-old child. Sheryl owns and operates a farming business, primarily planting and harvesting rice for sale. Sheryl has been engaged in her business for over 10 years now.

Sheryl joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sheryl has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. She is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which will be used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Sheryl from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok M. is a woman who is married with three children, two of whom are laborers, while the youngest one is two years old. Mrs. Sok M. was born in 1969. She and her family live in Srae Vong village in Takeo province.

Mrs. Sok M. is a farmer who owns 1.5 hectares (3.75 acres) of land she uses to cultivate rice to sell to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Moeurn Mao, is a laborer and, aside from this, he is also a palm juice collector who is able to earn some money from selling palm sugar to support his family.

Although this couple tries to work hard, they are able to earn only a little. So, to improve her family’s living conditions, Mrs. Sok M. is applying for a loan to buy a cow for breeding to start a new business. With the rest of the loan she will buy rice seed and fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding plus rice seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is a hardworking young farmer from the town of Kisii in Western Kenya. He is 33 years old and married with 3 children between the ages of 1½ and 6. Two of his children attend school.

Richard has been farming for 5 years and employs one farmhand. His products are bananas, tea, maize, beans and millet, which he sells to the local market. He also operates a spare parts shop (pictured above). His major challenges in farming have been the fluctuation in the prices of his products and crop diseases which affect his output.

Richard has a good record with Juhudi Kilimo, having successfully completed his second loan. He has requested this loan of 80,000 KES to expand his farming business by planting more bananas and purchasing a dairy cow. He says that with this loan, he will be able to increase his food production both for his family and for sale. He would like to practice large scale farming in the future.

loans.use: To expand his farming business and purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen N., 33 years old, is from Kamakoa area in Dunga. He is married to Judith Atieno who is a fish monger and they have three children. Danstan is 10 years old, Douglas 6 years old, and the last born Darling is 1 year old. 

Stephen is a carpenter and has been in this business for the past 3 years. He is applying for his second loan from Kadet Ltd after completing the first one without any difficulties. He wants to buy more timber to add to his stock which will enable him to make some home furniture which some of his clients have ordered. Stephen is very hard-working and always endeavors to work on the orders placed and finish them on time. 

He hopes that one day he will own a furniture shop that will enable him to expand and grow in business.

loans.use: Buy timber to add to his stock

loans.name: Lillian Akomo

texts.en:
Lillian Akomo Midimo, 51 years old, is from Kamakowa in the Obunga area in Kisumu city. She is married to John Midimo who is in the transport business. They have five children; the eldest is 28 years old and in college and the youngest is 18 years old and in primary school.

Lillian has a butchery in the Dunga area inside an estate and has been running it for the last 16 years. Her clients mostly consist of the residents who live in that area. She is applying for her 6th loan from Kadet Ltd and intends to buy more meat to add to her stock. Lillian is really hard-working and has employed one person to help her run the butchery. 

Opening another butchery is Lillian’s future dream and she truly believes that it will become a reality soon.

loans.use: To buy meat to add to her stock

loans.name: Ream

texts.en:
Mrs. Ream P., who lives in Srae Vong village in Takeo province, was born in 1959. She is a farmer who owns a two-hectare (5-acre) plot of land where she grows rice to sell to support her family. She is a pig breeder, too. Her husband, Mr. Noun Yoem, is a big pot maker who is able to earn some money to support his family.

Now, Mrs. Ream P.’s problem is that her field has infertile soil. So, to improve production, she is requesting a loan to buy more fertilizer. She will use the rest of the loan for making more big pots.

Mrs. Ream P. is the mother of two children, one of whom is helping her to farm, while the other is attending the local public school.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and make more big pots

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther N. is a 42-year-old widow from the Mosque area in Kisumu. She has four children; Beril and Yvonne are in college, Juliet is in high school and the last born, Alvin, is in primary school. Esther has the full responsibility of bringing up her children alone since her husband passed away.

Esther owns a retail shop and is taking out her fourth loan from Kadet Ltd, planning to add stock to her shop by buying sugar, flour, cooking fat and other grains. Esther’s credit history is good and she has been paying her loans well without any difficulties. Her shop is situated in an estate and her customers are mainly people who live in that estate and other passersby. She has some rental houses which are her secondary business and intends to use the profits to renovate these houses. 

Her future hopes are to get the children the best education and also buy a piece of land and build a house for her family.

loans.use: Buy cooking fat, grains, flour to add to her stock

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela A., 43 years old, is married to Maurice Otieno and they have three children: Winnie Anyango, 21 years old and in college; Dennis Otieno, 19 years old and a high school graduate, and Sheila Scovia, 13 years old and in primary school. They live in the Manyatta area of Kisumu city.

Pamela has operated a hair salon for the last three years and is now applying for her third loan, having repaid the previous ones. With a good credit history, she intends to use the money to add replacement stock to her salon including hair chemicals and human hair for braids. Her clients are mainly ladies from both the market centre where she operates and the neighboring estates.

Pamela hopes to open up a hairdressing school in the future.

loans.use: To buy hair chemicals and stock her salon

loans.name: Hin

texts.en:
Mrs. Hin P. lives in Srae Vong village in Takeo province and she was born in 1953. She is a farmer who owns one hectare (2.5 acres) of land that she uses to cultivate rice to sell to support her family.

Mrs. Hin P. is a widow with a child who is a seamstress in a garment factory. Although she and her child try to work hard, they earn less income than needed. So, to improve her family’s living conditions, she is a seeking a loan to buy four piglets for breeding plus pig and chicken feed to start a new business. With the rest of the loan she will buy fertilizer to support her field.

loans.use: To buy four piglets, pig and chicken feed, and fertilizer

loans.name: Pamella

texts.en: Pamella is a 40-year-old married lady. She is blessed with three children ages 14, 9, and 5. She has been tailoring for ten years in Kibera slums in Nairobi. She used to operate a salon. She also earns extra income from her retail shop. Pamella has been saving her money in a group in Faulu Kenya.   This has helped her because she can easily access loans from Faulu Kenya. Previously, she took out a loan of 20,000 KES and successfully repaid it. She has requested a loan of 40,000 KES to buy cloth lining, thread, and buttons. She hopes to expand her shop into a wholesale shop. She plans to use her profit from tailoring to improve the shop.

loans.use: To buy cloth lining, thread, and buttons

loans.name: David Mutua

texts.en:
David is a 25-year-old young man. He buys polythene papers and supplies them to the shops within the slum area. He has been in the business for a period of five years now.

He wants to use his loan to increase his stock of polythene for sale. He hopes to open a retail shop (kiosk) within the slum area.

loans.use: To buy more polythene papers to sell

loans.name: Douglas Mutuku

texts.en:
Douglas Mutuku is a 31-year-old young man, married with one child. He has a shop where he sells electrical items to his customers in Kibera slums. He has been in the business for a period of about five years now. He gets a profit of approximately 10,000 Kenyan shillings.

He was introduced to KADET by existing clients. He intends to use his loan to increase his stock of electrical appliances for sale. He hopes to buy a plot for building rental houses.

loans.use: To buy more electrical items to sell

loans.name: Anecito

texts.en:
Anecito N. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. He is 44 years old and married with 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Anecito plants and harvests rice for sale. Anecito has been engaged in his business for over 6 years and earns approximately 7500 PHP a month.

Anecito joined CEVI to improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anecito is requesting his first loan, for 5000 PHP, which he will use to purchase fertilizers and seeds. He plans to use the additional revenue to improve his family’s general living conditions.

About CEVI

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

Note

To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Khim

texts.en:
Mrs. Khim S. was born in 1956 and lives in Kanhchang village in the Takeo province. She is a bean-sprout seller who can earn some money to support her family. Her husband Mr. Mut Ouk is a farmer who owns 1 hectare of land in which to cultivate rice to sell to support his family. 

Mrs. Khim S.'s problem is that her family members do not have a motorbike to use to support their business. So to improve this condition, Mrs. Khim S. is asking for a loan to buy a new motorbike for transport. 

She is the mother of five children, one of whom is a teacher, while the others are attending the local public school. Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike for transport

loans.name: Anna Mae

texts.en:
Anna Mae P. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 24 years old, married and has a 3-year old child. To make a living, Anna Mae plants and harvests rice for sale. Anna Mae has been engaged in her business for over 2 years now. Like other entrepreneurs, she wants to be successful with her business.

Anna Mae joined CEVI to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid previous loans from CEVI. Now she is requesting her eighth loan, for 12000 PHP, which she will use to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. She plans to use the additional revenue to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase general farm supplies & equipment.

loans.name: Ernest

texts.en:
Ernest is 54 years old. He is married with 6 children between the ages of 10 and 26. Four of his children are attending school.

He is a farmer from Kisii town in Western Kenya, where he has been farming for over 20 years. He has two employees on a casual basis. His farm produces milk, tea leaves, maize, bananas, and beans which he sells locally. He is also employed as a teacher and owns a posho mill (a mill that grinds wheat or maize into flour).

His biggest challenges in farming are a poor transport network and lack of experience in dairy farming.

He has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 70000 KES to purchase a dairy cow. He says this loan will improve the health of his family since they will have enough milk for consumption, and it will also generate enough income to enable him to educate his children.

He would like to acquire at least 5 quality dairy cows that produce 15 litres of milk daily. Ernest hopes that Juhudi will continue to support them.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Benita

texts.en:
Benita P. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 43 years old, married and has school-aged children. She has been engaged in farming for more than 19 years now. Her income comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. She says she wants to give her family nutritious food to eat, clothes to wear, and proper education for her children. She also believes God is gracious to make her business grow.

In 2007, Benita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Benita has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Benita is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds and fertilizers. This will be the eighth loan taken out by Benita from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard T. is from Iligan City. He is 20 years old. Richard is single. To make a living, Richard owns & operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing motorcycle services to local community members. Richard has been engaged in his business for over one year and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Richard joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Richard is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Richard from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Chuyen's Group

texts.en:
Chuyen T. N. is 36 years old. She lives in Tien Kha village, Tien Duong commune, with her husband and two children. She is a farmer. She grows rice and vegetables and breeds pigs. She has a monthly income of about 2,000,000 Vietnamese dong (VND). 

She has participated in SEDA since 2006 and repaid punctually. She is the leader of five-member group loan with SEDA, a Kiva partner. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 7,630,000 VND to grow vegetables.

 About the other borrowers in her group:
 Xuan T. P. is 48 years old. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to breed pigs. Chu T. N. is 50 years old. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND for a small business. Toan T. T. is 57 years old. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to breed poultry. Vu T. T. is 30 years old. She wants to borrow 6,322,000 VND to breed poultry and for a small business.

loans.use: To grow vegetables

loans.name: Cerina

texts.en:
53-year-old Cerina D. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She has been married to her husband Gil for 25 years and now has 5 school-aged children. She farms and grows pigs for a living. She owns a rice field that she and her husband till together. While her husband does the major farming duties, she also spends time growing her pigs. She shares that one of their goals is to have all their children finish college and have a bright future.

Cerina joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Cerina is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase general farm supplies & equipment. This will be the eighth loan taken out by Cerina from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies & equipment

loans.name: Darwin

texts.en:
Darwin C. is from the village of Digkilaan, Iligan City. He is 32 years old. Darwin is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Darwin owns & operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing motorcycle services to local community members. Darwin has been engaged in his business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Darwin joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Darwin is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Darwin from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en:
Jenalyn S. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 34 years old. Jenalyn is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Jenalyn owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Jenalyn has been engaged in her business for over 12 years now.

Jenalyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Jenalyn is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase general farm supplies & equipment. This will be the eighth loan taken out by Jenalyn from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies & equipment

loans.name: Leilyn

texts.en:
Twenty-nine year old Leilyn G. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is married and has a 2 year old child. To make a living, Leilyn owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Leilyn has been engaged in her business for over 11 years already.

In 2007, Leilyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leilyn has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Leilyn is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Leilyn from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn D. is from the village of  Manticao, Misamis Oriental. She is 41 years old. Jocelyn is single and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Jocelyn owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling scrap metal & other used products in the local community. Jocelyn has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Jocelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Jocelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.
