loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Operating a farm has been a tremendous business venture for K. Peninah from Kafunga, Ibanda.

Having had a big family of six children and one dependent with a careless husband who does no productive work, Peninah worked tooth and nail to start up the sale of bananas which are commonly used to prepare a local dish by customers here in Uganda. She is so fond of her business and she is able to earn 1,500,000 Ugandan shillings as profits monthly.

This loan is to help Peninah do the mulching, buy stake poles for her plantation and pesticides. Further more, the expansion of her banana plantation project into a large-scale operation is her main motive for this loan. This will help her improve her production and sales revenue to enable her take care of her family.

loans.use: To expand her plantation project and buy mulches, stake poles and pesticides for increased production

loans.name: Liberty

texts.en: Liberty S. is from the village of Naawan, Misamis Oriental. She is 60 years old. Liberty is married and has six adult children. To make a living, Liberty operates a tailoring business. The main source of income for her business comes from providing specialty tailoring services to local community members. Liberty is just starting this business. In 2009, Liberty joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Liberty has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional fabrics and materials. Liberty is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional fabrics and materials. This will be the second loan taken out by Liberty from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fabrics & materials

loans.name: Gulbaira's Group

texts.ru:
В нашей жизни всё относительно. Если один человек позволяет себе каждый день обедать в ресторане и не считает себя при этом богатым человеком, так как не может позволить себе купить роскошный дом загородом, то для другого человека, который работает официантом в этом ресторане – это самая настоящая роскошь и признак обеспеченности. Аналогично, если кто-нибудь из вас тратит на один ужин в ресторане определённую сумму денег и считает, что эта сумма как раз и есть плата за разовое питание; то для другого человека, на другом конце света – это целый стартовый капитал, наличие которого сыграло бы решающую роль в успехе этого человека, и кардинально поменяло бы его жизнь в лучшую сторону. Молдокадырова Гульбайра – лидер группы. Гульбайре тридцать два года. Она вместе с мужем растит троих детей, две их которых ещё дошкольники. Чтобы прокормить семью, муж Гульбайры работает бригадиром на стройке, а сама Гульбайра предоставляет услуги швеи. Она начала этим заниматься, когда находилась на декретном отпуске. Теперь она шьёт национальные изделия на заказ. Благодаря этому занятию Гульбайра смогла купить корову. Работа Гульбайры не отнимает много времени и при этом ей удаётся зарабатывать ежемесячно около трёх тысяч сомов. Когда Гульбайра только начинала шить, она вложила накопленные ею пятьсот сомов на покупку тканей, надеясь, что у этого дела большое будущее. Её надежды оправдались. Три тысячи сомов небольшая сумма, но всё же позволяет Гульбайре удовлетворять кое- какие потребности. На данный момент Гульбайра надеется получить кредит на покупку тканей с целью расширения бизнеса. В будущем она мечтает купить машину и обеспечить хорошее образование детям. 

Партнёры Гульбайры по группе:

Садыковой Назгуль тридцать семь лет. Назгуль – разведена и самостоятельно растит двух дочерей. У Назгуль магазин, где она торгует продовольственными товарами. Назгуль начинала свой бизнес с продажи семечек. Назгуль надеется получить этот кредит, чтобы купить корову. 

Эралиеву Талантбеку сорок один год. Талантбек – отец троих детей. Жена – домохозяйка. Талантбек предоставляет услуги по перевозке грузов. Эта работа приносит ему двадцать шесть тысяч сомов. Но Талантбеку сейчас требуется помощь в виде кредита, на ремонт машины. 

Кожомкуловой Эльмире сорок один год. Она – мать двоих детей. Муж Эльмиры работает охранником, а сама Эльмира занимается животноводством и продажей молока. Эльмире нужен кредит для того, чтобы купить телят. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Gulbaira M. is the leader of the group. She is thirty-two years old, married with 3 children, 2 of them are in preschool. Gulbaira is a seamstress and her husband works as a foreman in construction. She started to sew when she was on maternity leave and now, she gets regular orders to sew national products. It allowed her to purchase a cow and she makes up to 3000 Soms (approx $65US) per month. When Gulbaira started to sew, she invested 500 Soms into new fabrics, hoping for a great future. Gulbaira is applying for a loan to purchase more fabrics and expand her business. She plans to purchase a car and dreams of providing a good education for her children in the future. These are the partners in Gulbaira's group. Nazgul S. is thirty-seven years old, and a single mother of 2 daughters. Nazgul owns a grocery shop. She started her business by selling sunflower seeds. Nazgul is applying for a loan to purchase a cow. Talanbek E. is forty-one years old, married with 3 children. His wife is a homemaker. He is a truck driver and applied for a loan for truck repairs and maintenance. Elmira K. is forty-one years old, married with 2 children. Her husband is a security guard. Elmira makes a a living selling her livestock's milk. She's applying for a loan to purchase young cattle. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

Translated from Russian by Susan Savkov, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase fabrics and materials

loans.name: Erlinda

The main source of income for her business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Erlinda has been engaged in her business for over 30 years. Erlinda joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 12,000 Philippine pesos, which will be used to purchase farm inputs like seeds and fertilizers. This will be the eighth loan taken out by Erlinda from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but also offers savings, insurance, and training programs, which are provided through regular cluster group meetings. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs like seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Ousmane

texts.fr: Monsieur Ousmane D.   est un jeune homme de 28 ans qui habite dans la localité de Ouakam. Il est membre de la caisse depuis 2 ans. Il est célibataire et il évolue  dans le secteur du commerce avec une expérience  de 10 ans dans la vente de vaisselles. C’est la rapidité  de la vente qui l’a surtout attire dans cette activité. Et c’est juste après les études  qu’il s’est oriente dans ce secteur d’activité. Il sollicite un crédit  de 250 000 frs prévu  pour l’achat de  vaisselles en vue de renforcer son stock pour ainsi satisfaire la demande de plus en plus croissante de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Ousmane D. is a 28 years old young man, who lives in the city of Ouakam. He has been a member of the credit institution for two years. He is single and has been involved in his business of selling pottery for ten years. The rapidity of sale in this business attracted him the most and he decided to get into it just after graduating. He is requesting a loan of 250,000 francs to purchase pottery in order to increase his stock and to be able to meet the always growing demand of his customers.

Translated from French by Monica Urban, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase stock

loans.name: Ubaidullo

texts.en:
N. Ubaidullo is 30 years old. He is married with two children. Ubaidullo is running his own café where he cooks shish kebab. His café is located near a railway terminal. He has been in this business for eight years. On average, he serves 20-25 clients a day. His wife and elder son help him with the business. Ubaidullo is trying to use only the best inputs in his café. Thus, the business is stable and brings considerable income for the family. He requests $1250 US Dollars to purchase meat and coal for his café to cook shish kebab. This amount would help him accomplish his goals in a short time. Ubaidullo wants to thank everyone who supports him.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase meat and coal for his café

loans.name: Asnat

texts.en: Asnat P. is a married small-business woman. She runs a business selling both fried and fresh fish to her customers. She purchases the business goods direct from the fish market at the Ferry at wholesale and retail in Dar es Salaam. She sometimes purchases direct from the fishermen by order at wholesale. She succeeded in buying a plot of land at Kigamboni ward in Dar es Salaam and she meets the children's school fees using the income generated by her business. She needs a loan of Tshs 1,000,000 to buy more business goods.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita A. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 48 years old, married and has three school-aged children. She has been involved in farming for more than 10 years now. She tills her land for rice and sells her harvest at her town's local market. She hopes to have an abundant harvest so she can earn more income.

Esterlita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Esterlita has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Esterlita is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Esterlita from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Ilhom

texts.en:
R. Ilhom is a lively entrepreneur with a small business selling clothing for women at the central market in Dushanbe, Tajikistan. He is a very experienced entrepreneur having been self-employed for the past five years. Business has been good for Ilhom. There is always demand for clothing and as the economy has improved in Tajikistan, more people have been able to afford new clothing. Ilhom is married with two children. In the future, he dreams of building his own house and of having and happy and friendly family. Ilhom has requested a loan of 6,000 Somoni to increase his available working capital. Eventually, Ilhom hopes to have his own small store. This loan will help him purchase new inventory and continue to invest in his business.     

  
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

loans.use: To purchase new clothing to sell

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora D. is from the village of Naawan, Misamis Oriental. She is 57 years old. Leonora is married and has six adult children. To make a living, Leonora owns & operates a business selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. Leonora has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Leonora joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leonora has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Leonora is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Leonora from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell
